description:
I was so excited to visit Sightglass Coffee in SF! My local coffee shop in San Diego uses Sightglass and I absolutely love their coffee! It's been on my radar for quite a while and when I knew I was planning a trip to SF.. this was definitely on my list of things to do. 

I thought the location was absolutely adorable and I was so excited to sip on coffee from the second floor. 

Side note: The second floor was pretty warm and the heat seems to travel to the top/the building does not seem well ventilated. However, despite the unusual heat - this did not ruin my experience by any means. 

Overall my experience was amazing! I ended up ordering a pour over, which was so delicious and reasonably priced. I would definitely give this a try!
author: Brittney V.

description:
The coffee is pretty good. I came by on a Saturday morning around 930AM, and there was already a significant line. The pastries are pretty good, if you want something to accompany your drink. Despite the long line of people in front of me, and the growing number of people behind me, there were still plenty of places to sit. My friend and I enjoy a morning of chatting and coffee. I liked my coffee enough to bring home a bag of beans. 

The most amazing thing about this place was how my friend, who used to work in the area, pulled out an old gift card from when the place first opened -- so old and weird, it was hand written on one of their first business cards -- and they still accepted it!
author: Jane H.

description:
I've enjoyed drinking Sightglass espresso and finally got an opportunity to stop by their location on 7th Street.  The vibe is cool and has a kind of techie/hipster feel to it.  It's spacious with a large bar in the middle and seating on both the first and second floors to offer their guests ample room to enjoy your coffee drinks.  

I've enjoyed their Espresso, Cappuccino and Gibraltars.  It just depends upon how I feel and if I want milk or none at all.  I like the Sightglass roasts since it typically has the right amount of acidity and is balanced really well.  

I was meeting a friend upon my most recent visit, so I ordered a Gibraltar and a Kouign-Amann while I waited.  Both were excellent as I passed the time waiting for my friend to arrive.  This is a really easy place to just relax and enjoy your coffee.  

The staff is really friendly and helpful.
author: Lon H.

description:
The coffee here is amazing whether you're buying beans for the house or  enjoying your cup in the shop.  The pastries are pretty great too, I got an apricot handpie and was delighted with how crisp and flaky the pastry dough was.

It's BYOwifi, which I hadn't realized until I unpacked my laptop but it's stated on this Yelp page.. so I should blame myself on not looking.
author: Morgan W.

description:
Meh. I don't think I'm into it. Visiting SF for a week and I saw that this was one of the coffee pilgrimages so I came in looking for caffeine and a place to do work. 

Pros: The employees here are great, both at their job and making you feel welcomed. The decor is interesting and simple. The coffee is definitely good, but it also cost a little more than most coffee from other third wave shops. 

Cons: As others have mentioned, there is no socket and no wi-fi so hopefully you have a hot-spot and your devices are fully charged. The seats aren't very comfortable and and the entire building is a bit too warm. The places is pretty loud too so bring some headphones.
author: Ji L.

description:
Today's order:
* Affogato
     * Espresso: Costa Rica Villa Triunfo
     * Number of espresso shots: 2
     * Ice Cream: Salt and Straw - Sea Salt with 
                           Caramel Ribbons
     * Cost: $6.75 after tax

Cons:
* No wifi
* No outlets

Pros: 
* It's definitely expensive side for an affogato,  
   however, I'd say their pricing is justified 
   for what is received 
      * Worth the craftsmanship 
* Good selection of Salt and Straw Ice Cream that  
   can complement the espresso really well
      * I say "can" because you decide which of three 
         espressos and ice cream you want to pair and 
         not every espresso might complement every 
         scoop as perfectly
* The barista gave good suggestions and clearly 
   stated his personal espresso notes
      * If you're worried about choosing clashing 
        tastes the barista can help in making your 
        decisions easier
* Nice chill work/conversation atmosphere
* A lot of seating, big space
      * Includes 2 floors, 2 large communal tables, 
         and a couple tables that can fit 4-6 people
* Very Instagramable drinks and location
* Always smells good
author: Dillon T.

description: On the pricier side, but definitely quality coffee. It's full of flavor and has a natural sweetness to it -- some might classify it as "sour" coffee (rather than bitter). If they had a shop near me, this would be my go to coffee shop for sure. Also, the pastry I had was delicious.
author: Jason D.

description:
Great location
Huge, oversized building that gives one plenty of room to contemplate relax or work!
A little pricey even for SF
When I would visit Pinterest I would stop by here and work. 
Definitely recommend.
author: Justin D.

description: Nice for work! I love the environment. There are many people, but not too loud. Love it.
author: Palm K.

description:
Fortunately, I was able to stop in Sightglass on my visit to SF this week. Their coffee is exquisite and I have no problem walking out of my way to enjoy it. They roast in house and it's open so you can watch their process. 

Today I went with the barista's V 60 recommendation, but every time I've had espresso, a cortado, or a latte they have such delicious roasts, prepared perfectly. 

Overall, love this spot so much and could sit in the atmosphere forever.
author: Max R.

description: I don't have much to say. One of the more inspiring spaces in the city for me. So peaceful and calming. Easiest 5 stars I've given.
author: Neil S.

description:
Sightglass is hands down my fav coffee shop in SF. 

Video sketch on 3 Sightglass coffee shops. 
youtu.be/CKyLAk5jzuQ

This location is in SOMA. Compared to shops on Divisadero(medium) or in Mission(small), this space is large size. It has 2 floors with ample seating. 

A bit different vibe than their other recent stores..(less cozy) but it's one of a kind. Mix of wood, concrete and sunlight creates a very unique interior, so I always take visitors here. The design detail is on a different level than other shops in SF. 

Stop here to get coffee and then walk to Vive la tarte to grab pastry. (5min walk)
author: Dee K.

description: The SOMA Sightglass is in a renovated warehouse space that features all of the same roasts, snacks, and gifts as the Divisadero location. There's just so much more space to people watch, work, and enjoy the surroundings away from the otherwise "up and coming" but industrial neighborhood.
author: Christine T.

description:
Sightglass Coffee is one of many "Third Wave" coffee shops in San Francisco and this 7th street shop is Sightglass' flagship location (established in 2009). Unlike most other coffee shops and three other Sightglass Coffee physical locations, this branch has a hanging bike rack at the front entrance as well as the affogato bar upstairs (affogato = pouring hot espresso on top of a scoop of ice cream and their affogato uses ice cream from Salt & Straw). Our group didn't notice the affogato bar when we came here at 8 AM because the bar opens each day from 11 AM to 6 PM. There is only bar seating on the first level, but you can go up to the second level for more table seating. However, I didn't like how you have to be extra careful not to spill your latte as you walk up to the 2nd floor.

***

Mushroom and Green Onion Sesame Tart ($5.50): Tart was crisp around the edges and I really like the mushroom filling.

Latte ($5): I definitely like this latte better than Four Barrel Coffee's latte; this latte tasted more smooth.

I also sampled my friend's cold brew iced coffee and it was better than my latte - iced coffee wasn't too sweet and tasted very smooth.

***

Overall this is a good all-around coffee shop (solid 4.5-star) and I would love to try their affogato bar if I do come back here again. I took a half-star off because I am not a fan of going up the stairs while holding a cup of latte and baked goods all at the same time.

P.S. - No Wi-Fi here.
author: Luke L.

description:
NO wifi
NO plugs
EXPENSIVE coffee
EXPENSIVE pastries 
INCONSIDERATE timing (my iced beverage was halfway melted by the time I received my hot beverage)

-Not a place I'd go out of my way to visit again.
author: Juliana C.

description: I started to notice Sightglass Coffee Shops showing up everywhere. I decided to stop by and taste for myself. I had a nice cup of joe at Sight Glass. Great place to people watch in this big and airy industrial space. Cheers!!
author: Stacie J.

description:
Bicycle pro tip: parking on the wall INSIDE the building. 

My bike is attached to a street sign because it's my first time here. Fail. 

Nice spot to pass some time and drink some perfectly prepared coffee beverages that are in all fairness a buck or so more than anywhere else I've bought coffee in SF. 

It's s big bright open space with skylights and good merch and a full line of their coffees. You can also see their printing operation for the labels and smell the roasting so if I have to pay a buck extra for this gorgeous space I'm kinda okay with it.
author: Mari H.

description: Amazing location, Coffee and pastries are to die for. This location is by far the best out of the 3. It can get a little warm upstairs though.
author: Danny R.

description:
Great little coffeeshop in SF and a huge multi-floor building with an additional coffee bar on the second floor. While it may be a decent place to study, wifi connection is practically non existant so don't come here expecting to work for a while. Unfortunately, seems to be a large trend with coffeeshops in the bay - no wifi in lots of them.

Great coffee and nice little pastries as well. Staff were kind and ordering was quick and painless.
author: Alex L.

description:
Roast is good enough without sugar needed for a latte. Smooth and easy to drink. Lacking some aroma. Nothing I was blown away by. 

The shop looks like a warehouse turned into a hipster spot. But don't expect to easily find a seat bc it's packed with people that camp out there on their laptop. I was there for 1.5 hours and only 1 person left. 

Poor service - took off a star for it. I asked for 1 shot of coffee instead of 2 for a latte and was told flat out they cannot do it because they always put in 2. Ok.....
author: Gloria T.

description:
I really cannot get over the loftiness of this place. The space is so bright and gives obvious homage to coffee and the coffee making process. 

A lot of people were meeting with small groups or sitting by themselves, overlooking the downstairs from the large loft space upstairs. 

I had a very delicious latte ($5), which normally is higher than I'm used to paying, but the quality is impeccable. I also got some delicious pastries. I would definitely recommend the pistachio with blackberry filling croissant and the kouign-amann. I was not as much of a fan of the potato and bacon gratin. 

If I lived closer to the spot, I would spend all my money here.
author: Jess L.

description:
My coworkers introduced me to Sightglass and I've been a fan ever since! My go to drink is the Iced Vanilla Cold Brew. I like my coffee on the sweeter so this was the perfect since it wasn't overly sweet. It was really cute that my drink came in a mason jar! Not sure if it was me but I felt that it tasted better since the glass jar was cold so it made my drink very refreshing. I've had this drink before but togo. 

This location is gorgeous with two floors and tall glass windows! I loved how there was an area on the first floor where you see the coffee beans roasting. Definitely smelled really nice 

I docked a star since seating was pretty limited and I ended up enjoying my coffee at one of the standing tables since I couldn't find any seats. I came on a Sunday around 11 am and all the upstairs  and downstairs seating were taken.
author: Frances K.

description: Very nice coffee shop. I went here with a friend while walking around SOMA. I love the ambiance here. I love the warehouse feel. There are two floors to this place. The entrance has vertical bike lock space with cool plants arranged. The inside of the coffee shop there is a coffee roast machine and the circular bar top around it. The second floor also has plenty of desk space for you to get your work done. The two bathroom are unisex bathrooms with a group sinks in between the two bathrooms. This is a very cool, chill, hang-out place. I wod bring friends here to drink coffee and catch-up, or bring a laptop and get some work done.
author: Lisa O.

description:
Solid coffee shop in SF! The iced vanilla cold brew at Sightglass is so delicious without being too sweet. Service here is pretty friendly which is a surprise given that so many of the great coffee shops in SF are slightly snobby. 

I like how big this space is too because it's relatively easy to find a spot to sit if you're alone/with one other person. The upper porch area is a great area albeit a bit hot. The surrounding area can be a bit dodgy but it's mostly fine during the daytime. Highly recommend!
author: Megan K.

description:
On a past trip to SF, I got a cup of coffee at this place in the Sunset. The barista told me about Sightglass. Two stories, large interior, great coffee. I bookmarked it immediately. 

Three days ago, I was back in the City and made some time to come here. The entrance opens up to a warehouse, converted into a roaster, cafe, hangout. The center station is where you place your orders, step back and wait. They will call your name, supposedly. 

My friend got an iced drink. I went for my usual cappuccino. He complained his wasn't sweet enough. My cap was good, but not the best. This had a hint of acidity and was not as smooth as I'd had hoped. 

The interior is 2 stories. Main station at the bottom, a smaller under utilized one on the 2nd floor. Downstairs, it's very spacious. A large roaster sits behind a fenced off section, but they cleverly placed counter seating against the fence. Good use of space. Other tables face the street. 

Upstairs, counter seating overlook the barista bar below them. Small tables are lined up against the wall. Behind another fence is the private cupping room. This is where educators offer coffee cupping lessons and tastings. It literally made me sad that I had to leave when it started. 

Also sharing the upstairs space appears to be their office space. Many workstations with people that don't look like they're socializing at a cafe. This is the biggest coffee house I've ever been to. And I like it! 

Then, there's this: At first, the cashier told us to wait to the left of the station, as the drinks will come out on that side. Five min. later, he asked us to go to the right side. We waited and a gal barista said the iced drink is back on the left side, but no one called his name when the drink was ready. 

Then, she made the wrong drink because she was unable to read the cashier's apparent scribble on a Post-it note. And no one called my name either. Was that cashier dude not "all there" that day? 

I haven't tried any of their pastries, but their price points for coffee drinks and food items are higher than most places. It's a great place, but their service skills are pretty sloppy. I'm very glad they serve the coffee drinks in a porcelain cup, and not in a paper one. So, I'd still return. 

Tips: 
* Downstairs, they usually serve blends, while upstairs is usually single origin. 
* Cupping lessons are complimentary, and happens on Fridays at 3. 
* Bags are beans and general merch on for sale. Maybe you can learn about their other blends @ the cupping event. 
* They rotate the blends,  it it seems the espresso based drinks is always Owl's Howl blend. 
* Street parking w/ meters, or about a block away, some free spots. 
* Restrooms are towards the right side near the back, once you enter.
author: James L.

description:
Came here for its name.

It's not really noticeable from the outside, you can easily pass by without knowing this huge gem place. It has 3 floors and I think only the first two are open to public.

The second floor has a small coffee kitchen where you can brew your own coffee. Tables are shaped very unique. The store is just great for photographers...

I had the quick coffee and a piece of almond cake, which is gluten free. It was spongy and not too sweet, great match with a cup of dark coffee.

The only thing that made me a bit grumpy is they don't have WiFi, not good for work, or at least for work that you want to get access to the internet...
author: Xuaner Z.

description: Good coffee, not great. This is a very busy coffee house, with another counter on the second floor. I wanted a small bite so I got a peanut butter cookie with a lot of sugar. I washed that down with a cortado. Not my best coffee house experience. If I had more time, I would have sat down, the space is pretty cool. They also roast and the operations are visible to customers. It's a pretty interesting place, to say the least.
author: Julio H.

description:
The Coffee 
I ordered their Iced coffee, could not remember​ the name but it's really good! I prefer their iced coffee over Blue Bottle New Orleans. 

Atmosphere
The place is medium to big size. It looks like a factory and inside, the place is really cool and very instagram-able :) ​

Service
Service was friendly and people were nice. The only downside was there's no WIFI. 

Overall Experience
Definitely would come back here again for their coffee! Would like to try their regular coffee like cappuccino​ or latte next time.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Worth the trip off the beaten path. Great coffee, good work flow made getting a morning late a pleasant experience. You can sit, enjoy and watch tomorrows coffee get roasted. 

Only thing I would suggest is open up a little on customer interaction.
author: Dan R.

description:
Nice place to hangout and have coffee with friends. Nice coffee and good place. 
Would recommend them change their coffee bings, not good for photo and feels like trash cans.
author: Alexis

description:
VANILLA COLD BREW!
I love taking people here because the place is huge and there a lot to see while you are waiting for your coffee. I can never turn down the chance to get that tasty vanilla cold brew. I also love that they have a good dairy alternative since I'm lactose intolerant. 

The location isn't the best, but for the huge space, I can't imagine where else they could be. I've never come to work here just because it's out of the way from any nearby BART stop, so I can't speak to that.
author: Erica C.

description:
Such a COOL Café and very good coffee in SF!!! I am very excited finding this place for catching up with my friends. Love this industrial style with lots of open space and natural lightings. Two stories, second floor is hotter than first floor. 

Price is very reasonable,  very hard to find parking. Well, this is SF, I expected it. 

I ordered ice coffee with vanillas, very tasty. 

I would absolutely highly recommend it to friends and come back again.
author: Keira R.

description: Nice chill spot, good coffee, spacious, and the vanilla iced latte is refreshing - @joeyngoy
author: Joey N.

description:
Sightglass Coffee is definitely a place for the born again hipsters of the city who swear they can taste every nuanced flavored note in their coffee. Don't get me wrong, they make a very good cup of coffee but if you're like me went to study in an aesthetic location and just need caffeine in your veins, you might be a bit whatever about the coffee. 

This location though is very cute and very nice. Don't expect any outlets nearby though, come with everything fully charged. The big wooded tables are very elegant and the industrial feel with lots of open space on the second floor make this cafe very desirable to go. But as a basic thermodynamics lesson will tell you, hot air rises and cold air sinks and when that hot air rises it can be a suffocating on the second floor so be aware of that. Otherwise come through and enjoy a very good cup of coffee and some solid interior decorating.
author: Michael L.

description:
Great coffee, HORRIBLE service!

I went last Saturday and the cashier was a black guy who was unfriendly and SLOOOOOOOOOW! It was like ordering from a robot who was losing it's battery life. Thank God I came in at the time I did because the line sure build up something awful and he was the only cashier. His vibe KILLS.....I think this guy needs more training or needs to look for a job that doesn't require him to be awake and dealing with the public. I expected more from Sightglass but this experience definitely showed that good service is hard to find.
author: This Is M E.

description:
Bad place if you're looking to get work done on computer: no WiFi and no outlets. 

Also, the upstairs was super hot. Coffee is good though - I had the latte with almond milk.
author: Thu P.

description:
With as many times as I've been here it's a wonder why I've not yet reviewed this place. My office is not only terrifyingly close but also overcrowded which gives me the perfect excuse to hold meetings here. 

Things I love: all of the things. No, but really. My go-to is their vanilla iced cold brew with almond milk. I also have a slight obsession with their shrub - it's not caffeinated but seriously delicious. 

Tip: They serve espresso-ice cream concoctions in the afternoons and they always have a dairy free option, too. 

The line can get pretty outrageous but there's magically always a place to sit. Fact: the best view along the mezzanine bar. There aren't very many outlets and there's no wifi (woomp woomp). 

If you're looking for a place that's delicious, affordable, great for people watching and/or having an intimate conversation this should be your go-to, too.
author: Capers B.

description:
Their mocha and vanilla iced cold brew were simply average for the price. It was nice that almond milk did not cost extra for those who are lactose intolerant such as I. 

HEADS UP IF YOU COME HERE TO WORK/STUDY: 
THEY DON'T HAVE WIFI AND THEY DON'T HAVE A SINGLE OUTLET. 

The first couple of yelp reviews did not mention anything about the wifi/outlet situation, and i think it's imperative to know if you are going there specifically for a work or study space. If I knew what i know now, i wouldn't have ordered my coffee to drink in the cafe. C'est la vie.
author: Jessie W.

description: The coffee was stellar although I'm unsure as to why San Francisco resist the option of syrup in their coffee. I'm not sure whether they think it's not 'sophisticated' enough for them. Either way, the atmosphere was great and the coffee was very good too. I ordered a generic latte which was creamy and tasted great.
author: Jack D.

description:
I used to work nearby when this place first opened up years back. It was great coffee and quick meeting spot then and still is now.

Came in with a friend who had never been, in a weekend, since it's never as crazy busy. 

As always, drip coffee was perfect, lots of spaces open to sit and chat, and service still as friendly as always.

Will be coming back again soon.
author: Robert R.

description:
I'm on the fence about this place. Just come with set expectations.

Love the ambiance here - rustic meets modern with wood accenting the roof and wooden tables, while featuring a large, open space with a ton of natural lighting. There's a decent amount of seating upstairs as well. Electrical lighting is limited, so it's best to study here during the day. This place is also the roasting and packaging location for Sightglass, which gives this place a 'busy and productive' vibe.

As a study/work place, meh. Outlets are limited or non-existent. Luckily technology allows people to survive the day without more power when fully charged. However, this place doesn't have internet, which is interesting, as people must be tethering to their phones or being productive in other ways.

Coffee is on the pricier side. There's no doubt that the coffee is good. This place is popular for a reason, but the latte is $5. That said, it is comparable to Sbux prices.

Lastly, my barista lacked personality and was stoic. The people closing seemed to have more personality, so maybe it was just that lady. She wasn't nice or mean, and I couldn't tell if she loved or hated her job.
author: Christina L.

description: Great vibe, but not enough outlet and no wifi which is disappointing because it is such a great place to work
author: Cindy Y.

description:
I was excited to try yet another cool-looking coffee shop in San Francisco. As other reviewers have mentioned, the space, ambiance, selection of pastries, and just overall vibe are great. 

I ordered a mocha (my default drink when the coffee shop does not have a signature or special drink) and a prosciutto with gruyere scone. The mocha was good, but compared to others I've had at many other great coffee shops, it was not the best one. The scone was great, but I was disappointed that they do not warm up the pastries. 

I wish I had read the reviews prior to ordering because I didn't realize there was an affogato bar upstairs. That sounds awesome!  I will be checking  that out next time and will update this review then, as I'm sure I will fall in love.
author: Melissa R.

description:
This review is long overdue. Since moving into this neighborhood, I've frequently enjoyed the bi-level loft seating and have always sipped on their house roasted coffee beans. 

My normal is the espresso with a splash of sparkling water to go with. 

They offer an array of pastries that are brought in locally, my favorite being the ones from Neighbor Bakehouse. 

One of my favorite coffee shops without a doubt. 

Bicycle friendly. They have a hanging bike rack at the front door.
author: Ann S.

description:
1. Location: 2.5/5. Hard to park. You need to walk into this place.
2. Service: 4.5/5. Very good. 
3. Quality and Atmosphere: 5/5. Very casual and comfortable. Modern in old rusty warehouse.
4. Price: 4.5/5. Very reasonable.

## Strongly recommend this place. Must stop by for the espressors. ^^
author: Justin C.

description: I love the Affogato Bar! Sea salt caramel ice cream with fresh roasted Ethiopian coffee is out of this world amazing! Very cool setting. Perfect spot to enjoy amazing coffee. Beautiful designed building in a 2 story old warehouse. Don't miss this place. Affogato Bar is upstairs.
author: Beth S.

description: My friend had this place recommended to him from a coworker so we went to go check it out. We came on a Saturday morning so it was pretty hard to find parking. But the place itself was pretty nice and had a hipster vibe. I ordered their vanilla iced cold brew and it was really delicious! I'd def recommend this place if you're a coffee lover!
author: Alexa-Ferl S.

description:
Very hard to beat! Have been an avid Sightglass consumer for some time now. 

The atmosphere of this new locale is beautiful. Very modern and relaxing. The service is cordial and very quick. 

Coffee is oh so smooth - always bags of newly minted beans as well. 

We snagged a Blueboon Blend (household favorite of ours) and the Yetatebe, Shakisso (excited to try this for the first time). 

Their cappuccinos and almond milk lattes are delicious as well.
author: John A.

description:
Fund stop for coffee! Big 2 story location with lots of coffees. 

Heads up:
- the place can run a little warm so be prepared
- the cold brew is a pre-made mixture of cold brew, agave nectar and vanilla so there isn't a plain cold brew
- iced coffee is an alternative to regular or cold brew but isn't as good as either
author: Sean R.

description:
Good pour over but the only way this place stands out in the SF coffee scene is it's beautiful interior design. Love the minimalist / wood theme, the second floor, and the vertical bike rack outside. They have nice hand soap for the bathroom which is a plus in my mind haha

Had the individually prepared coffee aka pour over: Rwanda (taste notes: Satsuma, Persimmon, Fig). It was a good light roast, meaning there was a citrus flavor to it but I was neither inceptioned by the taste notes nor did I taste the fruitiness. I'd say 1-D flavor bc all I tasted was citrus and this flavor didn't blossom in any way

I'd go back happily, but wouldn't go out of my way for it
author: Jeanie N.

description:
Stopped by on a Sat morning and the line was out the door. The coffee takes a while so it moved kind of slow. The pastries are from local joints like B Patisserie and Piccino among other places. 

Open seating inside and can get pretty crowded.
author: Veronica R.

description:
The coffee is awesome, but it staff here is just  unbelievably arrogant. I suppose a coffee of a small cap with a cost of 5 dollars, the customer, the least deserve some level of customer service.  The staff here in this particular Sunday morning,  said 'no' with two dead fish eyes, rude and loud, when asked ' are these two caps for me?  
Come on,  where is the SF local standard??
author: Stefani X.

description:
Oh man, I don't mean to be "that hater" but this has to be said:

First off, my family was visiting from Miami (which has pretty stellar coffee) so, was super pumped to try Sightglass. While their coffee was alright at best, the service was beyond horrendous.

As I was waiting for my group's 5 lattes & pastries, I was already enjoying their Ginger scone (which was pretty good actually) when unfortunately a piece went down the wrong pipe.  I know... the worst!

The barista (some bald dude) was staring at me with a blank look on his face as I'm literally grasping for water or any liquid that would subside the choking.

Instead of acting quickly, this dude starts giving me a whole run down (as he's glacially illustrating the milk foam in his next order) and tells me that the water I'm pointing at is for purchase only. Is this the Twilight zone?

Finally once his brain cells gave in, he gives me tap water (which is all I wanted).

If that's not enough, my husband was using the bathroom facilities (as my choking debacle was happening) and let's just say that aside for me still living, he was incredibly grateful for the copious amounts of coffee beans roasting in the background... because the deification aroma in those stalls were appalling.

Guys, I get that cafes are meant to be pretty chill but clean up your bathrooms and be better Samaritans when you see that your customer is choking.
author: Nicole T.

description: I really liked the vibe of this place. The drinks were all delicious. What caught me off guard was cascara shrub. It tasted a lot like fruit tea which had a clean and tangy flavor. It does have caffeine in it though.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I went with my friend at 12pm on Thursday. There was a good amount of foot traffic but it never felt too crowded. 

Nice space. A good amount of seating for customers. There are communal tables on the second floor. The layout makes sense so it wasn't confusing as to where to order or pick up. Interesting roasting area near the front of the entrance. 

Cleanliness (4/5): Super clean and stocked. I didn't see any loose napkins, spills or crumbs (except for the ones left behind after we ate) on the ground or on the tables. The condiment bar and pastry case were organized and clean. 

Customer Connection (5/5): Very friendly baristas. Cashier was nice and helpful with recommendations for pastries. After we finished we were about to put our cups and plates in the bus tub but another barista kindly asked to grab our dish ware for us. 

Service/Product (4/5): We both ordered iced lattes. They were okay.  I probably should've tried a shot of espresso. We also ordered Coffee Cake, Chocolate Raspberry Scone, Pistachio Croissant. They were all good! The cashier mentioned the pastries were from multiple bakeries.
author: Martin N.

description:
I really love the atmosphere! 
There's extra tables upstairs. You can order upstairs, but only one worker. While I was there, there was people on their laptops. I do agree this is a nice place to work and it is quiet. 

I didn't know there was other locations and I do want to compare this location with the others.
author: Kiyomi K.

description:
This is the best coffee I have ever had in my life, no exaggeration. Was it about the temperature? The overly nutty flavor? Or the almond milk? Or the foam? I was not quite sure, yet clearly the combination of all factors made the magic happen.

This is a roaster location, so you would also see huge bags of beans everywhere on the first floor. If you prefer a cleaner space to sit, do yourself a favor and come to the second floor.

Also, make sure you did not skip that lovely pastries. I opted for the fruit scone and was more than glad that I have done so. The crust was super crispy while the inside extremely soft, making the texture very unique.

The latte art was amazing too - I have completely fell in love with sightglass. 

P.S. they only carry whole milk and almond milk.
author: Elaine H.

description:
Food: 4/5      Price: 2/5       Service: 5/5        Ambience: 5/5

Hipster coffee place with a beautiful industrial setting. The coffee shop is a 2-story opened space place, with stalls around the edge of the building. Mostly natural light, the place can be a little dark at times. Got an overpriced latte at $5 - it was a tiny cup, SUPER HOT that it burned my tongue, and tasted mediocre. You can come here for the ambience, but probably not the products / price.

Ordered: 
* Latte ($5)
author: Victoria L.

description:
Terrible service.
No Splenda or other sweeteners.
Just sugar
author: E E.

description: Cute place with lots of space but there is NO WIFI whatsoever. For some reason this place came up when I searched for coffee shops with free WiFi. There's not even a little WiFi here. So, if you're looking for a place to sit and do some work, this is not the place
author: yardena s.

description:
Great coffee shop, you can see where they roast the coffee near the front, and there is an upstairs portion that has a nice ambiance and a good view of the whole coffee shop. Coffee is around $4-5, and they use these cool beaker glass looking items to make it.

I actually didn't end up getting coffee, though I did try some of my friends and it was delicious. I had this soda that was made with syrup from the extracts of some coffee beans, and had what resembled brandied cherries. It was delicious and quite refreshing on a hot day!

The staff was super friendly and our barista was very nice. Definitely a cool place and I'd love to come back some time to try the different flavors.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Wonderful service (very help, friendly, and fast), stunning space, and great coffee.

It's spacious and airy, with a loft reaching up two floors + natural lighting. Adore this place, but also wish they had more seating and wifi.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Delicious coffees and snacks. Industrial/Rustic/open/airy ambiance makes it a great place for drinking your coffee and lingering a bit here. There's always people on their laptop upstairs...but beware, Sightglass does not offer free Wifi.

I have a slight preference for Blue Bottle overall because the people working here aren't friendly. Every time I come they give me attitude.
author: Veronica S.

description: The vanilla cold brew here is so good! You get a choice of milk or almond milk at no extra cost. The store is huge because they roast and package their own beans but there weren't many tables and seats. I just stood at the counter near the water station and enjoyed my drink, but if you're coming here to work, it might be hard to snag a table.
author: Mindy T.

description: I have never had coffee affect me in any type of way until I went to Sightglass Coffee -- Now I know where to go when I am in need of a tremendous amount of energy. Shout out to the founder(s)!
author: Valerie R.

description: Love there coffee!!! I'm very picky how my coffee is made and they made it so good, that it's still on my mind to come back. Service was great and place is very modern and cozy!! Loved it!!!
author: Gladice R.

description: We got a croissant, Mocha Latte, and vanilla iced cold brew from Sightglass. It was good but pricey. There wasn't too much seating available on a Thursday morning but street parking was available nearby (not sure many people drive into the city though...). They also roast their beans on site, so that was fun to watch
author: Minh N.

description:
Love the space, hate/love that there's no WiFi! Came here to just do some work and the space was great but there's just no internet.
Despite the absence of WiFi sure enough everyone is... still on their phone.

Still, I'm quite pleased by the wide open space in this coffee shop, which is hard to find in SF. 

I'm not too discerning about coffee but they are a bit pricey (~$4-5 for a drink!). Still seems like a good place to hang out or study... probably not for a first date because it's eerily silent.
author: Cindy W.

description:
While I love the look and initial feel of this place, there were some things I very much didn't like and certainly wouldn't return because of: 

1.  Didn't feel like coffee and then don't have ANY tea options.  (okay, it's a coffee place, I get it but damn)

2.  The place was HOT AS BALLZ inside even on a 60 degree day. Not even sure how it could get that uncomfortably hot. 

3.  There was a huge coffee stain mess where I wanted to sit and the worker on the top floor wouldn't clean it up. Instead, she handed me a rag to do so. wow.
author: John H.

description: Hipster coffee place. Good coffee and delicious looking food. Good for families with kids as well as large groups of friends!!! Average prices and decent service, nice restrooms they are gender neutral.
author: Zoe M.

description:
This spot is around the corner from SOMA & Market. It is a micro-roastery and the coffee they serve there is specific to them only. 

I normally get their Colombian coffee over ice with almond milk. I often switch it up to their vanilla iced cold brew with almond milk also. Both are delectable and have notes that are on extremely different from each other. Their colombian coffee is strong, heavy, and tangy. It pairs well with their tart pastries and vegan chocolate cake.

The cold brew pairs well with the almond crossaint and everything crossaint. Their pastries are for the most part vegan or gluten free and huge!

It's definitely a hipster style vibe spot, and they offer WiFi and seating upstaires.  It doesn't get too busy so it's a great place to stop by during a lunch or coffee break.  If they had more options of coffee or styles I would give it a 5 out of 5. But for now it's a 4 from me.

Service is also fantastic! 
If anyone has any questions or concerns about this spot please feel free to contact me and ill be happy to answer anything that comes my way.
author: Jeremy Y.

description:
Heard this was one of the best coffee joints in SF and while visiting, I wanted to try and find out.  

My standard test is one double espresso for here, and a latte (to go in this case).  Cleansed my palette with the sparking water before my espresso, looked at the nice crema floating in the cup, took a deep smell into the cup, then sipped my espresso... and a VERY good shot!  Great velvety texture without any of the grit making it's way through.  Flavor was robust and well rounded, with just hint of the lemony acidity finishing the shot off.  

The latte was delivered next.  Nicely topped off with a leaf design in the foam, which is usually a sign of the barista taking his/her time with the drink.  I picked it up on my way to retrieve a lid and took a sip... and I stopped right in my tracks.  HOLY SHIT THAT'S A GREAT LATTE!

This has to be one of the best, if not THE BEST, latte I've had in my life.  And I've had coffee up and down the west coast (Portland, SF, LA).  I couldn't stop thinking about it for the rest of the day.  

One small half star I'd take off if I could is the barista completely ignored me after I complimented her that the initial espresso shot I had was very good.  She didn't seem super busy either, but could have been simply distracted with the other drink after me and just focused on the task at hand.
author: john l.

description:
The smell of this place is amazing. Right when you enter, there's a wall racks for bikes. I would recommend having some menus by the door. As a first time customer, I could not find the menu until I got up to the register, and by the time I look through the menu, the customers behind me will not be happy. Regardless, I asked for a recommendation and ended up with their Ethiopia blend (4.50 pretax). For a cup of coffee, it's definitely on the expensive end. I had mine in one of their cups to enjoy the environment for a bit. 

The 2nd floor gives a perfect arial view of the roasters. And you can see the beans being packed away in cute little packets. 

This places would be an amazing environment to work, but there are no outlets or WiFi. Perfect marketing technique to get people to not stay long. 

Would come back to try their affogato bar!
author: Teresa C.

description:
A very unique lofty/industrial environment for a coffee shop, where you can see different portions of the coffee process. I had a vanilla almond cold brew that ended up being $6 with tip, so it is on the pricier side but it was worth it in my opinion. The customers seem to be on the younger side, with many people hanging out upstairs either working at the large tables or looking down on the main room. 
The entryway has bike parking which I plan to use in the future. The only downsides I can think of is no WiFi or outlets, but that might help prevent people from camping out
author: Clayton B.

description:
Great coffee got a quad espresso over ice! The flavors in the coffee stand out and is really just a great coffee! The staff is friendly and patient! Big place 2 story's great place to hang out with friends or sit by yourself! 

Thanks
author: Nick N Parker S.

description: Came here with a friend from LA who likes doing hipster shi- lol. It lives up to the hype though. REALLY good coffee. I ordered the vanilla cold brew and it was probably one of the best cold brews I've had in the city. It's also a quick 7 minute walk from Civic Center Bart station. Also I almost forgot, the AMBIENCE - super chill, industrial vibes, wood + metal, you know what I mean... anyways, it has 2 floors. The first floor is where you order and where they actually roast/package the coffee beans (which is super cool), also has some seating. The second floor has more seating and you can look down and see people's orders being made. Overall, I had a really good time and I'd recommend all coffee fiends to check it out.
author: Sonya L.

description:
This is one of my favorite cafes on my San Francisco trip, not only does it have an open space with plenty of sunshine (when the weather permits) and staff who gives great recommendations (who stopped me from ordering a black coffee in the afternoon, and chose some beans to go) it has the best cup of strong coffee - for an expensive price, sadly. 

There aren't many choices on the menu, but the Owl's Howl is blended just for espressos - the latte was strong but didn't have an acidic aftertaste. 

Sadly, there's no wifi, but still a great place to sit down and jot down some thoughts!
author: Sabrina L.

description: After my 2nd visit I decided to write my review lol...the main coffee bar on the first level has your main coffee fair and pastries,the stand out pastry for me was the raspberry caramel croissant the chocolate chip cookie was good but kinda small for the price..the vanilla ice cold brew I had on both visits was good just enough vanilla flavor....Now the upstair affogato/espresso bar gets a 5 Star rating,the coffee float I had with double fold vanilla ice cream (salt and straw) had the prefect amount of coffee,soda water and ice cream...sightglass doesn't advertised the affogato bar so just head upstairs when you arrive...also this space is very big but they lack WiFi at the moment
author: jonathan h.

description: Great cup of coffee and I am a coffee snob; however, if you're looking for a quiet place to work this is NOT place for you. No outlets. No wifi. I understand the point they are trying to make with the "unplugged" environment however, everyone on the second floor has head phones in and a rapidly draining battery from their devices they are continuing to plug in to. No xinfinty wifi either to add insult to injury. Be warned, if want the unplugged vibe with a truly fantastic cup of coffee, come here. If you need to get stuff done, move on.
author: Joel M.

description:
I seriously did not know what to expect from this place when my boyfriend took me here. I wish this was located in Berkeley because I would seriously come here pretty often. Let me explain why! 

Parking:: 
Located in SOMA of San Francisco you should expect to do street parking or just uber there. 

Interior:: 
Before you enter the place they have this area for you to park your bike which is awesome because it feels like when you are in San Francisco one of the best ways to commute is to bike. This place is so spacious! They have a first floor and a second floor with TONS of seating! I would come here to study, but NOTE: NO OUTLETS OR WIFI. So come here if you want to study and not get distracted by your electronic device. 

Coffee:: 
They serve traditional coffee here and when you walk in you see a big coffee production machine. They have a ton of different types of coffee for their customers to choose from. It's like a coffee toy shop galore for adults here. I ended up ordering an iced latte and that was delicious! There are times when you drink an iced drink and the ice melts and it messes up the taste of the coffee, but some reason this one didn't. YAY!
author: Nadine Y.

description:
This is place became one of my favorite coffee places
The coffee is insanely tasty and smooth
The vibes are awesome
Very stylish interior
Extremely fast service 
This place is a must visit and I'm definitely going back again!
author: Joe D.

description: Great place for coffee in the city!  When you walk in there is such a lovely smell of coffee! Seeing the huge barrels where coffee is grinded is really cool experience. There is plenty of open space downstairs and upstairs.  But upstairs you get the best view. The latte here is my go to and you can't go wrong with variety of pasties they offer.
author: Iryna P.

description: Sightglass has some of the best coffee in San Francisco and the coolest aesthetic! I love that pretty much all of their stuff is authentic. They roast their own beans, make their own mugs, bake their own pastries...they even have customized espresso machines! I recommend getting a raspberry chocolate scone. They're honestly life changing and they're huge too!
author: Daniel C.

description: Nice open space with bike racks. I was in the area and this seemed like a good place to do work on my laptop. However, I was wrong because this location does not have WiFi.  Guess that is good for those looking to just catch up with people and not be on their phones at all. The coffee was pretty good but a bit pricey in my opinion.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Sightless Coffee is so cute!! I've never been to a coffee brewery before, so going here was a cool experience. Being a coffee fanatic, it warmed my heart seeing bags of coffee beans and the huge machine that makes the coffee. 

This place has two floors. The first floor has a couple spots for people to sit at, but most people work upstairs. You can get some baked goods downstairs, and move up. I ordered an affogato upstairs, and sat at the rail for a while. It was super relaxing, because you get to overlook at the coffee machines downstairs while looking out of the huge glass window. 

I would definitely go here to hangout and study if I were from the bay. It's a cool place to go to.
author: Melody S.

description: We're really starting to love this brand. We've been to this location in SOMA a few times and it seems to get better each time. The make a great cortado and the overall aesthetics are gorgeous. Hopefully they expand in to Marin where they would be welcomed with open arms, especially in San Rafael. Just sayin'.
author: Theart P.

description:
Been living in SF for a while but just found this place. Very cozy, urban coffee shop. Great for studying, but no outlets.

Definitely liked sitting on the second floor. As long as you don't need to charge your electronics, I think it's an ideal place for studying.
author: Do P.

description:
Finally got the opportunity to try Sightglass (haven't gotten it before because they charge for shipping w/ no threshold for free shipping), and if you are near a shop it is worth it. 
This space is beautiful, and has a very cool loft where you can sit. You get to watch the whole bagging operation right in front of you, which is not something I've had the opportunity to see before...Their service is great, there was no line at all. Terrific single origin pour over, the coffee was delicious from the first sip and got better as the cup cooled to drinking temperature. I bought a bag of Las Florestales, and it was also excellent when I brewed at home. Overall a great experience, it's worth the stop if you are in the area of one of their locations...they would get more of my business if they offered free shipping.
author: Brett B.

description: 3.5 stars. Cool coffeeshop. Very airy, good for people watching and getting work done. It felt a tad bit warm to me when I first entered. They also have an affogato bar and tasting bar.
author: Cece Y.

description:
Great interior. Hipster coffee place. 2 floors. Nice place to study.

I don't drink coffee, so I didn't get anything, but I tried my friend's americano and it was good I guess? Lol. I don't know what's good coffee so I can't judge. But it wasn't bad!! 

Not much for this review because I'm not a coffee head ^_^
author: Esther Y.

description: I love their affogato bar (try it with the lavender ice cream). One of the best affogatos I've had. Their baristas have been consistently (of the four times I've gone) wonderful + I haven't had an issue with seating yet
author: Trang B.

description: This location is aesthetically beautiful and it's a good place to hang out. Whenever I'm in this part of town I make a stop here, order a macchiato, and take in the lovely space.
author: Sandy G.

description: Good but could get expensive! I don't how how my latte ends up to be $7 every time. I guess that's SF for ya. They charge for almond/soy milk. LOL I still go all the time tho. Haha
author: Debra N.

description:
Latte : extremely-balanced coffee and milk; caramel sweet after taste 

Ambience: Indistrial style three level space; on-the-spot coffee roasting and grinding / packaging production line
author: Lily C.

description: My favorite meeting place in SF - everyone loves a meeting held at Sightglass!
author: Cary C.

description:
When it comes to world-class craft coffee, San Francisco has plenty of worthy contenders. Sightglass isn't necessarily any better than Ritual, Four Barrel, or Blue Bottle, but it's not any worse, either. I have enjoyed stellar coffee from them all and enjoyed very pleasant return visits to each one, but if I were forced to choose a favorite of the four, I'd lean heavily towards the Sightglass "mother ship" in SOMA. I particularly like the range of Pacific single varietals that Sightglass carries, along with a wide range of East African, Central American, and South American options. 

The Sightglass coffee packaging (a box and bag) are basic brown and can easily be composted or burned in a fireplace or wood stove, which I really like. I also use them to store cheese once I've removed it from their plastic packaging. Prices are high, but comparable to other city roasters who care about things other than the bottom line when it comes to locating coffee growers whose labor and land practices are sustainable, fair, and humane. My coffee strategy is to drink less quantity and focus instead on high quality, so the fact that eco-friendly, progressive businesses like Sightglass are successful positively warms my heart.

I also love the artisinal ceramic cups and plates used, which have a rough yet comforting feel. And I love seeing the Probat roaster in such a prominent ground floor location, along with other signs of a working roastery that remind you of all the hours of labor that go into the process of making such exquisite products. Yes, there is a lot about Sightglass to love!

The second floor loft is the ideal space for enjoying your coffee and looking down on the milling crowds below. I have had so much fun watching the staff at Sightglass work. It's like a well-oiled machine, or a bee hive, lots of moving parts, beautifully orchestrated.

In the end, it's about more than the beans. It's about the people who work here, and the people who come to enjoy the coffee and other small bites. While other places may look more fancy or be located in trendier neighborhoods, I'll stick with Sightglass on 7th, any time I am heading into the city.
author: Camelia N.

description:
Nice Staff.
Great Coffee.
Cool Vibe.
More Seats on Second Floor.
No Wifi.
Good Place to Chat.
author: Youngree K.

description: Nice place to have coffee and chatting with friends! Also you can feel in a coffee shop, but if you come here to work or study like I did. They don't have plug to charge your mobile even WiFi. Is a shame coz they place is very cool
author: Danielle F.

description:
Really good latte! Smooth and well-balanced coffee. I can say this is one of my favorite lattes I've drank. $5 well spent.  I also like the spaciousness of the place.  Good to just hang out, enjoy your coffee and read a good book on a weekend!  
The almond cake is good too.
Their brewed coffee is kinda strong though.
author: Abby Q.

description:
i got the vanilla cold brew with whole milk. its smooth and the vanilla is not syrupy sweet at all.  that said, i could barely taste the cold brew as the vanilla overwhelmingly strong.

speedy service with a pretentious yet sterile vibe. i was confused and found it hard to work here.

fyi, no wifi...
author: Jason C.

description: The coffee tasted meh but the local brewery thing is awesome and cool ambiance.
author: Apoorva D.

description: Excellent croissants and coffee and great 'industrial vibe'. Very clean bathrooms are a total plus. I really like the seats upstairs to have the coffee quietly and reading the news and observing people. Downstairs is more a 'drink and go' kind of style and I like to take my coffee with time. I really appreciate the use real coffee cups and they are good looking. Would not be the same with paper cups. Service is fast and not extra friendly but proper. I also like the cute bicycles at the entrance, nice 'hipsterian' touch.
author: Carmen V.

description: This is a cute place BUT they didn't have air-conditioning when I was there. My friend and I drank our latte in the heated building. Their decor and service was good, I'm just having trouble enjoying my coffee as I sweat.
author: Pailin E.

description:
COFFEE is phenomenal. Coffee is flavorful and affogato is delicious. I love the coffee here so much, that I even bought a bag. As for the affogato, I still have dreams of this heavenly combination. This location has an affogato bar on the second floor, where you can customize which espresso and which ice cream you want.

WIFI is non-existent. And so are OUTLETS. This is not a good place if you need either of those. But it makes sense since this is such a wonderful place that everyone wants to camp out. But just be warned!

However, this is a nice place to read or do other work that doesn't require wifi. This location has a nice open space that is very soothing. There's a good amount of seating and tables. There's also a second floor with more seating and tables. It can get a little stuffy, but it's usually fine. 

Staff is FRIENDLY and will also give you great suggestions. They really know their coffee and put up with your indecisiveness (at least they put up with mine!)
author: Julie L.

description:
A beautiful space to sit and relax. The service is awesome. Only downside, the latte isn't the best.

Came here around opening time on a weekday. Walking in, I was instantly awed by how much space this location has. Early in the morning, but before the business rush, there was no line. The cashier and barista were super friendly, which is always a nice start to the morning.

However, I would say the almond milk latte I got was not up to snuff. The espresso was good and almond milk fine. The main issue I had was that the milk was lukewarm. Now, I'm all for not burning my mouth on scalding beverages, but I do expect my coffee to be warming.

Hopefully this was a one-off and I'm willing to give them a second chance. But if you only have a few days in the city, skip this place and try another.
author: Angela C.

description: It's a cool lil place, I thought it'd be some wack hipster place but nah you should really check this place out. This is the kinda place that people should go to. This is the kinda place where you can really taste the flavor of the coffee instead of some lame hype. The customer service is great and it's a real cool place to just chill. They have plenty of phone charging outlets. too.
author: Luke S.

description:
It took me half a year to find this huge, famous coffee spot a block away from my apartment, but better late than never...
I love how open this two-story spot is- there is tons of natural light coming in! Downstairs is pretty cramped for seating but there is plenty of seating upstairs. 
I've had the vanilla cold brew (~$5), which was some of the smoothest coffee I've ever had. I've also had an affogato from the affogato bar upstairs, which uses ice cream from salt and straw. I asked the barista what the smoothest coffee was, and she recommended the Ethiopian so I got that over the salt caramel ice cream! (~$6) It was so rich and delicious, although I do wish there had been more coffee. 
The only downside is that this place has NO WIFI, so be prepared to tether to your phone and finish half your months data allowance in one sitting! Great trade off for such an aesthetic environment and smooth coffee.
author: Jordyn Yian C.

description: Beautiful interior and great coffee. Tried the drip from Guatemala and was happy my coffee craving was met. A great place to study and stay caffeinated.
author: David Y.

description:
Very large open space for coffee lovers, readers, writers, internet surfers, friends and people watching.

While visiting SF, we decided to check the place out and discovered, as most coffee houses in SF, they only served 2 types of latte, plain and mocha. Strange that most SF cafe's only serve these 2 types, but ok, let's roll with it! I ordered the mocha and it was quite good. Quality was there, smooth mocha flavor was there, it was slightly sweet but not too sweet, which is good.

I was pleased with my mocha, but will only give it 3 stars because of the expensive price, small cup size and lack of latte flavors. Can we get a vanilla latte with homemade vanilla syrup? For the price, I don't think it's too much to ask.
author: Brian P.

description:
A good kind of coffee to start my day. Their coffee is really delicious!

 I prefer their iced coffee over Blue Bottle New Orleans. I bookmarked it immediately. Now, I got my new fave place for my coffee escapade. Simply love the ambiance here, with a ton of natural lighting.
author: Althea C.

description:
Wait - No Wait

Value - $5 / dish.

Dish Size: Medium

Vanilla Cold Brew with Almond Milk -  A must order. This cold brew is smooth, refreshing, not to sweet, and slightly acidic. It sets itself apart from other cold brews with the addition of vanilla which I believe adds a richness. I would also suggest ordering it with almond milk, at no additional charge, as it adds a nice nutty undertone to the coffee. 


If not just for the coffee, you should visit the SOMA Sightglass location just for the space. It's a open airy light filled warehouse where the space is shared between the production equipment, retail space, and office spaces. 

The entrance is setback a bit from the sidewalk to create a vestibule for wall mounted bike parking. At times the large sliding door is open, creating a free flowing and open space with the outside. The main features on the ground level is a large island bar and production roaster. It's pretty interesting to sit at the bar and watch the staff roast the coffee beans in front of you. On occasion, you can even see them scoop the beans into the final package. There's a small retail space where you can buy the same equipment used to make your coffee. As most craft coffee places these days, Sightglass uses digital scales to measure the weight and flow of the coffee in every step of the process, thus ensuring each cup is a consistent high level quality. In terms of taste, Sightglass has a variety of beans with different flavor profiles to choose from. In addition to the amazing coffee, Sightglass also offers pastries by Neighbor Bakehouse. If you don't know about Neighbor Bakehouse, be sure to read my review. Then order whatever pastries you can get your hands on.

The second level is lofted space that overlooks the entirety of the store. There's a handful of bar seating right next the handrail, which is a great place to setup and people watch. As opposed to the bar only seating on the first level, the second level has quite a few large communal tables. There's enough space for you to bring your laptop to work or a text book to study. It may have just been me, but I do not believe Sightglass offers wifi. Off to side there is a area where Sightglass holds weekly classes to teach the craft of brewing coffee and a small affogato bar! 

The SOMA Sightglass location is the full package. It offers great coffee, a beautiful space, and an amazing experience. If you're thinking about a place for coffee, I highly recommend the SOMA Sightglass location.
author: Julian L.

description:
EVENT: catch up with the guy friend - you know... boys have feelings too... lol jk! A great place to chit chat for hours... yes... I'm one of those people who sit around for hours and hours... at a coffee shop... for a catch up!

DRINKS: 
Affogato - Dude.. you know me... from Melbourne, Australia... and we LOVE of coffee.. and one of the things  I miss so much is affogatos! And when I found out I can get it here... DUDE! I'm ON IT! So, basically affogatos - ice-cream with a shot of espresso! Pretty interesting here - you get to pick your espresso AND your ice-cream... this is pretty fancy compare to where I'm from! So, I got the salted caramel ice cream and a shot espresso (can't remember which one I got) LOVE how the ice-cream just melt over time and your coffee gets sweet. Great dessert coffee!

**OVERALL - Must get... affogato is the way to go!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
Best coffeeshop around, both for the excellent beans, and the absolutely beautiful (and huge!) space. All wood, metal beams, soaring ceilings and wall-length windows, it is a haven from city life, with enough space to accommodate all of the students, crossword-doers, frienddates and etc that you'd want. 

I wasn't in a caffeine mood the last time I was there and tried their shrub, which was delicious and different. I appreciated the variety!

Pro tip: if you love sightglass beans but not their prices, they sell their lesser roasts through Imperfect Produce at a great price.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Coffee is very yummy, but seriously wish they had outlets. The open space and lighting is great for studying or reading a book. Lack of outlets is probably the one thing that keeps me coming back as frequently though, since I look for coffee shops for entire day study sessions, and no outlets just ain't gonna cut it :/
author: Linda C.

description: Delicious coffee and divine pastries. Vanilla cold brew is a dream. The man in front of us ordered one of each pastry available. I think he had the right idea.
author: Alexandra G.

description:
Went here once, and will probably never go again. I am not a coffee connoisseur whatsoever, and maybe that is why I don't dig this place. They do not have any syrups, no Wi-Fi, lots of seating, did get a hipster vibe from the coffee crew, has decent ambiance (I like the natural look and lighting), but that's pretty much about it. 

If you are all about coffee, straight up, neat, or whatever you coffee gurus call it, straight black, this place is for you :)

This little coffee turd likes her coffee sweet, and will go around the corner to Vive La Tarte   for some amazing baked yumminess and coffee to my liking. 

Hope this helps :)
author: Geraldine H.

description: This place gets warm, so take that into consideration and wear removable layers. No WiFi, so a positive depending on the type of work you need to get done and your ability to focus. Finding a seat was easy enough and I got my own table after sharing with a couple folks before they left. Finally, my Vanilla Cold Brew with Almond Milk was $4.83 which for SF is a win.
author: Jan Kirby Z.

description: Good coffee. Best thing is their interior and myriad of good looking San Franciscans.
author: Khanh T.

description: Great local coffee, cool atmosphere, yummy pastries, and cool place to hang out.  There are 2 stories in this coffee shop with plenty of space to sit.  Whether you're there for a quick cup of coffee or there to relax and enjoy a book, there is plenty of lighting and seats.  The only knock against this place is the location.  Be careful of your surroundings, one street over and you're on 6th street (a little rough, but nothing unexpected if you're a local).
author: Justin Y.

description: The best drip coffee that I've had. They have amazing pastries as well. Plenty of seating (upstairs and downstairs). In the morning during commute hours the line in this place can be a little long but it typically moves far as they have efficient customer service.
author: Michelle F.

description:
Legit, some of the best beans in all of California. Expensive beans but absolutely worth the money. Try out a pour-over for here, grab a pastry (or gluten-free macaroon, SO GOOD), and sit upstairs overlooking the roasting area. It's definitely a hipster place but the service is still top notch. 

Bring a fully charged laptop or device to sit and enjoy your coffee (no outlets for re-charging) and head to your nearest Sightglass Coffee location now. :)
author: Lori T.

description: There are great coffee places in SF. I was really looking forward to this one, testing it out with my drink of choice: a latte. The drink itself was just average, and actually kind of watery for such a small cup -- not the sweet and creamy I was anticipating. Also, honey lovers, be-warned they don't have any to sweeten with, just raw sugar. The interior is nice, which is likely half the appeal, but intentionally no outlets, which leaves me with an unwelcoming bitter taste.
author: Mark A.

description: Overpriced pretentious coffee shop. It's baffling for coffee shops to not offer public outlet for charging so you don't stay long. Do yourself a favor and just don't come here.
author: Nicholas W.

description: Beautifully designed but inefficient amenities. No WiFi nor power outlets, minimal airflow in guest seating area. Hard for working on the go. Great for coffee drinking and book reading.
author: James R.

description: These guys know their coffee! Very dedicated to their craft and the espresso is great.
author: Johnny V.

description: They seem to think their coffee is so good that they don't need to provide cream for their customers. I thought maybe they were out of cream so I asked the guy behind the counter and he confirmed they don't offer cream at all. That's a deal breaker for me and my overpriced cup of coffee went straight into the trash. I wish I had known before ordering.
author: Lindsey T.

description:
This place sucks. I met a potential client here because it looks really nice but it's the furthest from it. 

There are work stations but no charging ports and NO WIFI...

Also the place has 6 people working behind the counter and they only have like 7 menu items...how is that efficient. 

How about you work on your process and pay the frickin $150/m for WiFi with all your savings?

And...I've had better coffee
author: Robert S.

description: As a coffee enthusiast, this coffee shop is one of my favorites in this area. I was visiting a friend one day and they took me to this coffee shop and I was very very pleased with everything they had to offer. The seating arrangement makes the place feel so spacious and so modern and aesthetic. This was the first place I had ever experienced an Affogato and it was delicious. The coffee was rich and the ice cream was perfectly sweet. Overall it was a delicious balance of coffee and ice cream. Next time I go, I will definitely try more items off the menu because I bet everything is delicious.
author: Izzy M.

description: The place is pricey.  But lots of young startup folks do meetings.  I can see why.  It's a converted warehouse space with the coffee beans roasted on site.   Coffee is about $5 up (pricey) and pastries are about the same so it's $10-13 for a sit down drink / snack.
author: Leung T.

description: The space is incredible and has tons of seating. The coffees we tried were very good, although not the very best in San Francisco. But definitely a place worth giving a try.
author: Ricky P.

description:
If I lived in the area, I would totally just come here and chillax! I came here on a Sunday afternoon around 3 pm to rest my feet since I walked around the city for a bit already. The location isn't super ideal since the area isn't exactly bustling. However, it's a nice place for a piece of mind amidst the quick footsteps! 

+1 Beautiful architecture! I really love how they utilize the natural California sunshine to brighten up the place. 
+1 Two stories high! The top is packed with lots of tables for group study sessions. There is also a "bar" up here, if you wanted to order affogatos. 
+1 cheap prices! Oh hey! Not overpriced coffee and great quality too. 
+1 The "WC" are gender neutral! Though there isn't a clear line of where it starts....but everyone is courteous and somehow formulates a line.
+1 How exciting is it to watch the unexcited man do his job of roasting gallons and gallons of coffee beans...but seriously though, turn that frown upside down! 
+1 Their "for here" mugs are the most soothing things ever. I could just holding it forever...(you'll know what I mean when you order something from here.) 

-1 Only downside is that they don't have WIFI....WUT. So I could only stare into space and converse with the people around me.

Overall, love the place. I'm excited to try their other blends, but you can't really go wrong with the basic Blueboon Blend!
author: Hurjane V.

description:
I met some people while waiting in line at another bakery and they told us to check this place out. It's basically a very spacious 2-story coffee/tea shop that has a nice view on the second floor. I wasn't planning on getting anything, but since we were here, I decided to get the everything croissant with cream cheese, smoked ham and gruyere morning bun, and a pistachio croissant with blackberry jam. 

I didn't realize until afterwards that their pastries are made by Neighbor Bakehouse. All of the baked goods were pretty tasty, but I think they are known more for their coffee! Looks like a nice place to study or just relax and/or catch up with friends.
author: Dung N.

description:
I came in and said "I want a nice pick me up" from there my Barista suggested to me Vanilla Iced Cold Brew I thought to myself "great another cold brew but hey when in Rome ( or SOMA). So I ordered the vanilla ice cold brew with almond milk. As I waited (the whole 3 minutes) I noticed it was the beginning of the roasting week so they were roasting coffee beans. When my coffee was up I took a sip and BAM! It was amazing. Way better than the cold brew at Starbucks. It was a great balance of sweet and strong. 

If you are looking for something cool grab a cold brew!
author: Desmond A.

description:
this is one of the first places i've ever visited before i even moved to the bay area so it will always have a special place in my heart. 

they have great pour over coffee, which is the only thing i've ever gotten here. i'd like to try their espresso some time because it looks delicious! it's a really cool place to meet up with people or do work as long as you don't need wifi. the couple times i've been here there's always a place to sit. 

to me, this is the only location to go to. i haven't been to the other ones, but i just really like this location with its big roasting machinery. definitely give this place a shot if you haven't already.
author: Enoch C.

description: Dear #SightGlass, This is why I don't go to #hipster #coffee spots in #sanfrancisco!  I kindly asked my #barista to top off the initial pour of the #icedcoffee I  ordered  and this is what he gave me: a cup that's about 75% full, of which 40% is actual coffee, 35% ice, 25% empty and 100% #ripoff!  This is why people hate the #bayarea!  #gentrification at its finest.
author: Larry W.

description:
As a barista, whenever I spend some time anywhere away from home I love exploring the local coffee places. I was excited to explore what San Fransisco had to offer. After exploring some of the others near my office, which left me slightly discounted in their over roasted, badly pulled Esspresso I finally stumbled into Sightglass. It became my home for the next couple of weeks, where I would work after the office had closed and on the weekends when I was in the area. The esspresso is terrific and the baristas are nice and very accommodating. The upstairs area can get very hot because of the roasters but that can be a nice break from the typical chilled San Fransisco air. 

There are great Afogatos upstairs, accompanied by an assortment of single origin espresso. I haven't totally hopped on that band wagon yet. I believe that good espresso can just be good espresso and just because it's "single origin" doesn't necessarily make it good. But at Sightglass, they definitely have good espresso.
author: Alex A.

description:
One of my favorite coffee houses in the city.  Pain to park but that's the city.  

I love the huge spacious warehouse.  Where you can see the coffee business in action.  Roasting on the right (I'm not a coffee expert but that's what I thought it was), packing in the left, training upstairs and their office as well.  

You can sit downstairs or upstairs and see it all go on.

I like my ice coffee and the cute cup design that goes along w it.  Great for an IG post.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Gia C.

description:
Maybe I like Sightglass because it is the closest (good) coffee near my work. Maybe it is the beautiful open space with floor to ceiling windows, giant coffee roasters in the center and the chic hipsters serving up my espresso. Or maybe it is the upstairs bar that serves single origin espresso (with sparkling water of course).

Oh, yup. All the above. This place is great, even the bern was feelin it... http://sfist.com/2016/05/10/bernie_sanders_stops_by_sightglass.php
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Tried their cappucino at the ferry building farmers market and just had to check out their brick and mortar. 

Got another cappucino and yes it was just as tasty as the first. Dark and roasty, thick yet smooth.

The establishment is quite nice and spacious- a rare find in SF.

I'll definitely be back for more coffee and maybe stay to read a research paper.
author: Raymond L.

description: The cold brew is outstanding. Really cool atmosphere. People are friendly and there is ample working space as well as plenty of standing room to socialize.
author: David H.

description: Espresso Amazing....Lattes Amazing.... Over all Amazing!!! We are out of town celebrating our Anniversary one year yay!!! But this coffe spot is the best thus far. Good people Great coffee
author: Dennis C.

description: Best cappuccino I have ever had! The place has a great atmosphere. Once could get a lot of work done here. The bathrooms are clean and the staff is friendly. They have a nice covered wall bike rack, this is the coolest coffee place I have ever been to.
author: Albert M.

description:
Been spendin' most our lives living in a hipsters paradise .... should weird AL have updated his coolio jam after getting an espresso at Sightglass... the irony hurts at this place.

The product they serve, tho menu limiting is great. I feel that the atmosphere that seems to be emphasized by the employees and their attitudes is the unwelcoming hipster type - if this is a refuge for the ironic clandestine bicycle riding revolutionists, please post that on the door. 

I found where all the four barrel patrons went!
author: John O.

description: I love the atmosphere here. Relaxing on the second floor while enjoying a cup of coffee is a great way to start the morning. The pour over coffee is fantastic.
author: Ted G.

description:
Awesome cafe in SoMa! I'm surprised I haven't visited any earlier. As a biker, I really appreciate all the bike lanes en route to Sightglass AND their super awesome vertical bike racks!

Sightlglass is located in an old warehouse, I believe... so it's really spacious with plenty of seating. I'm sure their coffee beans are fresh too since they have the roaster on site!
author: Janet H.

description: Hipster coffee at its finest. Ok but they do have an cool ass location. I didn't know what to expect when I first stopped in . This place is so spacious. You enter in through a giant opening then walk over to place your order. They serve traditional coffee I'm a macchiato fan so that's what I get When here. The coffee is good and fresh. While you're waiting on your drink check out the location so many cool things to look at. Oh yeah if you have to potty they have a restroom. Like a lot of the new places you have to use it then come out to wash your hands . So don't freak out of you don't see a sink in the restroom lol. This place also has lots of seating. You could either chill on the first floor or sit upstairs. I prefer the upstairs better to people watch. So be sure to check them out if you're in the area.
author: Tony B.

description:
Solid coffee, to bad the person at the counter couldn't be bothered to answer simple questions.

The barista was friendly, and accomplished.
author: Jane D.

description:
Tl;dr Great place - but could be so much better!

Great, unique and interesting coffee and pastries. Wish they had Wi-Fi, and outlets. It was really hot the say I went and there was no ac or fans. The best views and cool looking wearing was blocked off for their office space, which was totally unused.
author: Jason P.

description: Good coffee. A little overpriced for what you get. Nice location but needs fans for the rare hot days.
