author: Nicole C.

description: Delish flat white, lovely delicious shots of espresso with beautiful aesthetic and yummy cookies. What more could I ask for in this charming third wave coffee spot. I'll be back when I'm in town.
author: J. M.

description: With a fortunate incident, i happen to procure this liquor of gods, the cold brew coffee with almond milk. As an avid almond milk drinker myself, i was pleasantly surprised at how well the tastes meld together to form harmony. In fact, I'd go as far as to say this is the best cold brew i ever had period.
author: Ji T.

description:
By SF standards, this place is HUGE.  What sets this place apart from other coffee houses are its ultra high ceilings and a loft area stocked with tables and chairs where you can lounge and take in the view from the balcony.  

My latte with cute art design was $4.50.  My raspberry chocolate scone was also around $4.00.  Minus the art design, the latte itself was decent-- not the best latte I've ever had.  The raspberry chocolate scone however was unique in that it was slightly crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.  

With a place this size you would think they would offer wi-fi.  They don't.  That's why I'm taking off 1 star.  I'm thinking they are trying to discourage people from hanging out for several hours.
author: Lorie N.

description:
Extremely delicious, super creamy lattes that are simply the best. The ambiance is also very neat - it's a great place for a grab and go coffee or to catch up with a friend.

Only cons are there's no wifi, AC, or soy option.
author: Amy G.

description: I'm a coffee lover and they definitely know how to make a good cup of coffee. My favorite is expresso!
author: Gustavo C.

description:
There is definitely a very cool vibe when you step foot into this Sightglass location. The open coffee bar and production roastery really make you feel as though it's a place for serious coffee. Being the flagship location, the two level space really hits the mark in terms of wow factor and ambiance.

Unfortunately, the beverages are somewhat average and non-distinct. I ordered a Cappuccino and Vanilla Iced Coffee which were pretty standard in taste and not overly acidic. Some of the African blends carry more of a fruit flavor but again, nothing eye opening. 

In short, this is a good place to people watch and hangout. Honestly, savoring a cup of hot coffee on a cold San Francisco morning ranks pretty high on the enjoying life spectrum.
author: Simon M.

description:
As someone that doesn't drink coffee (caffeine doesn't sit well with me), I often struggle to order at fancy, hipster-ish coffee shops. On past visits, I've typically gotten a hot chocolate at Sightglass, which has a very deep and rich dark chocolate taste. It can be a bit overwhelming at times, especially one warmer days. 

However, I went recently and decided to order the sparking cascara shrub, which the barista described to me as "the pit of the coffee cherry" and then sparking soda is called in with a sweetener. I absolutely loved it! It was so refreshing and the taste was tart and usually I don't like carbonated drinks either, but I couldn't stop sipping it. It was also a bit warmer and so the iced drink was a nice relief. 

The drink was so nice I actually debated buying the cascara shrub syrup that they also sell, but decided against it as I was sure whatever I would try to concoct would not be as good as what the barista made. I've finally found "my order" at Sightglass Coffee!
author: Isabel C.

description:
Posting this review after being at the coffee shop a few months ago. But I thought it was worth the review.

This place is a coffee lovers dream. Loved the on-site roaster, the coffee is outstanding, the pastries were delicious, and the vibe and aesthetics of the place are on point. 

Wish I lived in San Francisco. I might be broke going to this place every. day. all. day. 

Go there!
author: Eric G.

description: The coffee was okay, I wouldn't say it's anything special to be honest. I much prefer iced coffee at Mazarine Coffee. The location and vibe is great, staff was friendly. What really makes me mad is the fact that out of 3 gigantic bars, 7 ish huge tables, and god knows how many square feet, there's isn't a single damn outlet I can plug into in here. If you're trying to get work done go somewhere else.
author: Christian S.

description:
The place is really cool, nice to chill at and very spacious. The coffee is kinda basic for a more modern place like this. The menus are only at the counter and aren't visible while in line. Both upstairs and downstairs are set up really nice and make you want to just start studying but they don't have wifi or outlets. 

The pros of this place is the ambience, other than that it's an overpriced coffee shop.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
A space right across the street from where I work. 
The coffee is a little pricy, BUT it is worth the extra charge you get from the wonderfully strong cups. 

The coffee is always fresh, made one cup at a time. The staff is always nice and great at making recommendations. 

The atmosphere would be considered "hipster" for most people, but I enjoy reclaimed wood, low warm lighting, and large tables in a warehouse style building. It is a warm, comfortable place to escape the streets of soma when I do decide to treat myself.
author: Crystal A.

description: Had a cappuccino which was really well executed. The foam on top has super tiny bubbles. Coffee is more acidic and brighter than other places. It also has a more oily and full mouthfeel. Enjoyed the relaxed vibe of this place, space felt open, uncrowded, large tables upstairs to sit with random people.
author: Elaine C.

description:
Sightglass Coffee set the bar and they set it high.

Before visiting Sightglass, Blue Bottle was my favorite coffee shop, but like any good champ their reign has ended.

Everything about Sightglass is right-- beautiful space, warm baristas, and excellent coffee. Those are just the basics. They also have an amazing affagato bar, open coffee education classes every Friday for the community, and the bombest cold brew on the West Coast. Like I just can't...I want to have this cold brew everyday from now until forever. So good!

The affagato bar isn't something I've seen in LA, so that was a real treat. I had the Colombian espresso over the toasted coconut and pear vegan ice cream and my life was changed. The best coffee pairing I've ever had. 

I know I sound like a crazed hipster, but check my Yelp stats, I've been to A LOT of coffee shops and this right here is the best I've ever visited. 

Now my only qualm...when can we get a Los Angeles location!!?
author: Stephanie P.

description: My friend and i want here to grab a cup ofcoffee over some pastries.The quality of there food stuff and coffee taste is amazing.Quite and calm place with good infrastructure built over.the service is very quick with love serving on the board.
author: Eva G.

description:
Coffee shops, as a business, operates on two things: good coffee and service/ambience. I live nearby and I've been here a couple times now-sure, the coffee is good, but oh god do you need some staff training program, especially when you proudly call yourself an establishment that services this tightly knitted locale and community. 

Asked for espresso on ice, came out hot. That's totally fine. What is not fine is when I tell the barista," um, I asked for iced. Would you mind also putting it in a to go cup?" And the barista responds with," yeah, yeah, yeah, hold on." Asks the other barista how to MAKE an espresso on ice in front of me, and then reluctantly PUSHES a glass cup of espresso in front of me. I again ask for a to go cup, and she just glowers at me. The other patrons waiting for their coffee looked at us quizzically. Overall, an unfortunate experience that really marred the brand for me. If you don't like to serve people, maybe you should consider another job?
author: Kelly S.

description: Sit upstairs and have a great view of the shop. Very cool ascetics and awesome coffee. I was here in 2013 and is just as awesome as I remembered. Love this place!
author: Grayson W.

description:
Coffee as theatre....this is a pretty spectacular place.

Coffee shop doesn't really do it justice, they roast their own beans, pack them, train barista's here....all under one roof, it just adds to the authenticity and coolness.

The coffee was astonishingly good, I had an almond milk cappuccino and an iced vanilla coffee.

The pastries were a surprise, in a good way, the pistachio and jam was as good a pastry I've had in a long time....

Superb.
author: John B.

description:
This place is far too smug and overpriced for its average espresso. 
Staff seemed stressed and unfriendly and despite the onsite roasting the coffee was nothing special.
author: Marlee B.

description:
I know...I know.  This is the flagship.  The mother ship!  You know...SHIP your pants good!  And yes, the coffees I ordered were just so good.  But sometimes....the hype is just not met for one reason or the other.  This time the reason was that the single origin coffees are only available at the bar upstairs.  What?  Ugh.

So I schlep my carry on luggage upstairs to get my coffee, and lo and behold what do I see?  Some great community tables!  All full.  Full of what?  People at their computers doing some strange version of Bikram Yoga.  Super silent in the famous "Staring Apple" pose.  Thankfully the Macbooks that everyone had were made from aluminum and they had a higher melting point.  Sure...I will admit that I looked like a middle aged man who had run away from home and was just waiting for my ride back home, but the strangeness of this moment was not lost on me.  Literally not one word was spoken in the beautiful baking loft, aside from my awkward mumblings to the barista serving affagatos and espressos.  

But to the coffee.  I had intended to order up a decaf espresso and a regular cappuccino.  But the kind barista steered me in the opposite direction.  Thankfully she did and I was able to get a very good single origin and the house decaf was just bold enough to come through the warm milk.  This was officially my second and third coffees for the day....I would have one more just a little ways away at another famous coffee roaster.

Aside from the heat in the loft area...I love the openness of this business.  Great use of the building and I will look forward to coming back with my wife in tow.  The real question now is....will she walk 10 miles to have 4 cups of coffee?  Let's hope not.
author: Robert S.

description:
Poor customer service.

The coffee is fine of course, and the space is neat with nice jazz music ambiance.

I walked up to the counter with no other customers in line.  Employee was fixed on the iPad register didn't acknowledge my presence, not even after 8-10 seconds of me standing right in front of her.  
It took the initiative of another employee to help me out.  
I would like to say that this is a one-off ignorant, uninformed employee; but the one who did serve me was next to clueless about the coffees they were serving.  
The over-all vibe was that I should feel privileged to be a customer, rather than they having the privilege to serve me.
My bottomline suggestion is for Sightglass to better train employees for customer service.

There is no Wifi.  To me that is a "no-no", especially if you aren't offering a cheap cup of coffee.  I understand that they may be trying to evoke a more social atmosphere, but the reality is that people function through the internet, and a coffee shop of this caliber should provide its patrons with the basic 21st century need of internet access.

On a positive note: I like the booths.
author: Reed B.

description: I would say the coffee is probably a 4 , but the aesthetics of the place boost my rating up to a 5. I love the urban cafe vibe to this place. Being able to see the workers grind the coffee beans on the spot!  Definitely a cool place to study! Highly recommend.
author: Cortney T.

description:
Pros:
-Design-feels like you've walked into a rustic barn in Vermont that has been converted to a roasting studio.
-Coffee-no frills, yet coffee purists will love the "whole milk or almond milk" only options for lattes. Don't expect to overhear a "vanilla skim latte with an extra shot and whip" please. 
Cons:
-Often crowded with egomaniacal tech chatter and pretentious 'holier than thou' hip millennials who believe their trendy t-shirt & hair coloring will prevail. 
-Have been to the SOMA location several times and clearly staff is hard to keep happy; scowling zombies from local art schools--on the verge of their next YouTube sensation-- will delight you with screen-face-monotone then giggle and cavort with cohorts.
author: Ronald P.

description: Fast and nice service. Quick line and plenty seating. Lots of bike racks on the wall. No dogs inside. Proficient supply of croissants and breaded snacks by B. Patisserie, and there's still stuff left at 4pm. Clean bathroom. Sad there's no Wi-Fi, oh well. And for the ppl who Complain about high prices, go to McD's. If u go out in S.F., u know good coffee is $3.5-$7. 2 thumbs up here.
author: Miss J.

description:
quick tips:
- the line moves impressively quickly
- coffee here is on par with other Sightglass locations

HIGH LIGHTS

On a Saturday morning, there were about 10 people in line before me, but I don't think I waited more than 4 minutes. There were 2 cashiers.

They have 2 machines, each with 2 brew heads. They were only using 1 machine at the time, but it's good to know they have the capacity for really busy times.

The space itself is really beautiful. The glow of the lights made the concrete walls appear warm and inviting. There are about 5 large communal tables, and most seats were taken. It seems good for groups, but bad for intimate chats.

They have an express window! It wasn't in use when I went, but it wasn't that busy.

There are 2 single occupancy restrooms.

low LIGHTS

None. I mean, it's a coffee shop.

OVERALL

Sure, I'll be back. There are already so many coffee shops on Divis, but it doesn't hurt to have more options.
author: Jiann M.

description: Came out in an attempt to find the coffee that is served at my local cafe at home. Sadly the coffee is only sold wholesale but the staff there was sweet enough to introduce me to other coffees and even gave me a website that I may be able to find my coffee. Which I did!!!
author: Sue T.

description:
My favorite when not drinking Viet-style coffee. While their cappuccinos and lattes are good, a regular coffee is my favorite here since it is simple, yet so good and smooth. A regular iced coffee with added sugar works for me on a warm day.

The interior is inviting and I like the high ceiling. It's too bad the location is out of the way. Not convenient to MUNI Metro/BART so you will have to drive or find another method to get here. No Wi-Fi means no hanging out here for an extended period of time. It is quiet if you want to get work down though.
author: Peter L.

description: Two story coffee shop! The first I have ever been to. I really appreciated the modern, user friendly bike ramp they offered right at the front door. It made my life easier and every coffee shop should mirror this! The baristas were helpful with the menu, friendly and efficient. The coffee had a little kick to it but I didn't care because they roasted it right there! What other coffee shop is also it's own roaster?! There's tons of seating in this place, and even a bar upstairs that I didn't realize was there until I went up to find a table. If only they had AC and spots to plug in a cord..
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
I'll preface by saying that I'm not a big coffee person.

Sure, I love the robust aroma. And yes, Haagen Dazs Coffee Ice Cream is probably what carrots taste like in heaven, but generally I'd much prefer a good tea over coffee. I'll even admit that I prefer Starbucks over Sightglass just because of the variety. 

So, why am I always at Sightglass every morning? I got addicted to caffeine. The wife's work schedule got shifted so we're both up crazy early, and with the extra hours of work I put in at my second job, besides my regular 9-5, I found that I needed coffee just to be able to enjoy Friday and Saturday nights. Now, I drink coffee almost every morning. *sigh*

The atmosphere of Sightglass is warm and inviting. I always wish I could stay, but I generally drink my coffee back at the office. I do wish Sightglass had more variety in drinks, but the coffee snobs at work always seem to approve when I come back with my beverage. 

There's a Starbucks a few blocks away and a Teavanna at the nearby Westfield City Centre that I personally prefer over Sightglass, but I find myself here often because it's the closest to work. 

Casual coffee fans like me may prefer other places due to lack of variety, but the loyal and dedicated coffee fans seem to love this place.
author: David D.

description:
I'm not sure that I'm actually cool enough to be allowed in this hipster heaven at Sightglass. The dark, warm wood and openness of the ground floor and loft invite you in, and your eyes aren't sure where to land among the giant roaster, wall of beans, and people watching. Succulent terrariums? Check. Antlers? Check. Aesthetic bike racks? Check. Escape up to the loft for a glimpse of it all (and a second bar) and chill at a communal table with chairs that'll take you on a trip down memory lane to middle school. That is, unless it's warm out because it'll be hot as hell up there. They really need a fan up there to make drinking a warm beverage possible.

Note milk choices are limited (only whole or almond), but you're not here for the milk, you're here for the rich, bold roast and the this-is-where-the-cool-kids-hang-out atmosphere.
author: Cristina S.

description:
Solid coffee, even better ambiance. The space is incredibly spacious and bright -  two stories with a high ceiling. I'm sure Instagram goes crazy over this place! We opted to sit upstairs, overlooking the entire coffee shop! 

The coffee was delicious but tasted really strong for a non-coffee expert like me. 

For those looking for a work space, this place is limited as there is no wifi and no outlets.
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
For those who are looking to be laptop rats utilizing free wifi after buying 1 small cup of coffee and that's all (for 10 hours), this spot is not for you unless you're bringing your own wifi (via cell phone or if you have hacking skills). The preceding sentence was long.

With that sentence, 2 sentences ago, being said, this is a great spot to actually appreciate some good coffee and actually get to know someone. I guess that also means you can't be on your phone either. At any rate, the coffee snobbery her is off the charts. I'm talking baristas with abstract hairstyles, vegan-centricity, selling fair trade single origin coffee beans, an espresso bar, wooden everything, big windows for natural light, large community tables, and that cool young San Francisco startup company vibe. I like how one of the walls is the same pattern as Goyard.

Bottom line is that this is a true place to grab some coffee and just chill with someone in a setting that's less prone to having people with their eyes stuck on electronic screens.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I loved the ambiance and the decor. But I'm only giving 3 Stars cuz the barista was a bit of a Coffee snob. I'm not big on coffee but still, I don't think anyone deserves the sass. Maybe he might have had an off day, but still, not cool. 

Parking: street parking

No Wi-Fi

Ambiance: casual

Seating: upstairs and downstairs. SEAT yourself.
author: Krystal G.

description: My hubby is obsessed with coffee and to him Sightglass is like a temple to come and experience divinity! I agree with him on how perfectly and sincerely the coffee is made here and also about the character of community and collaboration that this very hip and chic coffeeshop offers. Another plus is, in the weekends this is one of the few coffee shops open in the evening. I am now addicted to their caramel sea salt affogato. Pouring a kenyan brew over the yummy gelato reminded me of Kilimanjaro and our trip to Kenya. Amazing blends, great coffee artists and an ambience that has to be experiences for its openness and warmth!!
author: Harsha G.

description:
An amazing open space that has two levels. If you're looking for an affogato then head up to the second level where there is another coffee counter to order at. I got the Ethiopia espresso with blood orange olive oil ice cream affogato. It was really creamy with a slight bitter taste from the blood orange. Their vanilla cold brew tastes especially good with almond milk and I like how they don't charge you extra for using almond milk instead of whole milk. 

Seating can be hard to find because there's always people at Sightglass. Upstairs has big workspace tables with people on their Macbooks or carrying conversations. Downstairs has counter seating and the front entrance has a bench across from the bike racks on the wall. 

Sightglass truly has that hipster tech start-up vibe going on and it is a great place to meet up with friends or colleagues. You will probably even see small casual business meetings taking place.
author: Diana C.

description:
Love this spot. Never disappoints though it is a lot for coffee it is par for the course in SF. 

Pistachio croissant with blackberry jam and a slow brew Ethiopia! Delicious!!!

The only place I can drink coffee plain and it is slammin'
author: Ish A.

description: Beautiful space with great lighting and friendly barista! Love this new addition of Sightglass Coffee to this neighborhood.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I rarely come here for coffee anymore. While the shop is nice and it's well-designed, the coffee itself is always way too hot and it's overpriced. I don't like how there's only one size and there's no outlets or wifi. 

Service is alright and the place is pleasant to be in. If you're stopping by for a pleasant chat with a friend and want to show someone out of town a stereotypical coffee shop that fits the hippy modern vibe of San Francisco, here's the place to go.
author: Nancy W.

description: Perfect coffee! I had the Ole one day, regular drip the next day and a latte the third day. Was staying a block from this place. Their pastries and muffins are exceptional as well. Tried the pistachio crosaint and the plum muffin, loved both of them. They also have some nice savory pastries which you don't get at many places. Eat in, this place has a cool decor with a roasting machine at the center of the store.
author: Ravinder S.

description: love this place! the vanilla cold brew with a splash of almond milk is heavenly, it's brewed with real vanilla (you can even see the vanilla specks in the drink!) very industrial chic vibe, and they roast their coffee beans in store which is mesmerizing to watch.
author: Lakshmi R.

description:
This place is sick, can't believe it took me this long to find it (shout out to my uncle who lives in Taiwan for telling me!)

The vibe here is soooo SF: open space, refurbished wearhouse, hipsters everywhere, natural lighting, random terrariums, overpriced coffee (wouldn't appreciate it much since I don't drink coffee). love it. This is a great study space and a great first date spot.

I had the sparkling Cascara shrub, which is made out of the coffee fruit and tastes like kombucha. It was pleasantly light and although pricey, worth it in terms of being able to enjoy the relaxing environment of the coffee shop.
author: Sunny K.

description:
Okayyyy reallly not feeling the mocha here. It was sour and bitter. How does that even happen? I had high hopes for this place because it's talked about so much, but the mocha was just really not good at all. I was super not impressed and totally wish I could've gotten a refund. However, the vanilla iced cold brew was pretty good. If I ever have to come back here again, I'd probably get that. 

On the bright side, the ambience here is pretty nice, but a little bit too loud for studying unless you got some good earbuds to tune out all the people shouting at each other. This place was really popular on a Monday afternoon, but at least parking wasn't difficult. Oh also just use one of the free wifi's around the area and you should be fine!
author: Catherine S.

description:
Definitely one of the most hipster coffee shops I've ever been to.
A huge plus for this place is definitely that there's two stories and lots of seating room, a huge con for this place is definitelty that there is no wifi :(.

I'd come here again if I was in the area and wanted a place to do work and didn't need wifi, but honestly the coffee isn't anything amazing enough that I would come all the way over here and figure out the hassle of parking, which is basically as horrible as it is anywhere else in this part of SF :/
author: Andrew T.

description:
I haven't made a review in a long time and only use Yelp to discover food joints I haven't been to (tons, of course!) and experience it myself for my blog. Anyway-we love Sightglass it's nearby our place and it's honestly The Most chill, laid-back coffee spot we have ever been to (so far out of like 7 we have gone to) WHY ARE PEOPLE COMPLAINING ABOUT THIS JOINT FOR THEIR LACK OF WIFI GLORIOUSNESS? :( 

Pre-dotcom era, you go to a coffee place to unwind, relax, chat with friends, (people watch), and really just being chill. I get that you'd expect ALL coffee spots in SF "should" offer wi-fi but it's not anything to complain about and give this place a negative review just for that. Sure, bad customer service is a minus so I do hope management will take notice of that but just giving it a bad review because... "i can't connect to the internet life is over" ..... Sigh. Why not sign-up on one of those co-working spaces?

Almond milk owl's howl latte / cappuccino is our go-to btw. They also offer b.patisserie pastries YUM! With this summer we're having, go try their affogato at their affogato bar! Also, we haven't experienced negative customer service from them so far hoping that we'll never experience because we really love it there. We literally just get our caffeine fix, chatting or just watching them do their roasting magic. Yay Sightglass! (Dear mgmt, hope you are reading the reviews of bad customer services...)
author: Erica R.

description: Strong  and cool latte art! Not too noisy of a place to do some work and/or just chit chat
author: Rose T.

description: Cool athmosphere and a amazing place to combine coffee and work. Lots of space and cozy environment. Wooden tables and great coffee.
author: Hubert F.

description:
This rustic coffee house is a breathe of fresh air in a city with too many cookie-cutter coffee options...
Would've got the fifth star if the wait wasn't so long (at 10am, a couple of times. Not like that is rush hour??) But positive all the same, I will go back many times.
author: Craig M.

description: Expensive but delicious coffee. Get the vanilla cold brew ($4.50), it's sooooo goood. You have two options for choice of milk - almond milk or whole milk. The original drink comes with whole milk, you should try it before substituting it with almond milk as it does affect the overall flavor of the drink. No pets allowed inside so you will have to leave your furry friend outside and keep an eye on him or her through the glass windows. There is plenty of seating here, downstairs and upstairs. It's a good place to meet groups of friends or to go with your coworkers for a coffee break. You can order coffee upstairs as well, but everything on the menu downstairs is not offered upstairs.
author: Saachi G.

description: Excellent cafe. The location is fantastic and great ambiance, and the coffee is delicious. Good pastries as well. Definitely check it out.
author: David P.

description:
This is an incredibly awesome spot for a coffee shop. I have been meaning to try something new and came here right after a workout session at the gym. Sightglass brews up very good coffee plus, they have a good pastry selection.

Seating? There's plenty of it available, upstairs and downstairs. The latte and steamed milk certainly paired well. I enjoyed the taste of this latte and the roast is perfect. The pastry - Kouign-Aman is delicious with a flaky, buttery crust and caramelized sugar filling. This pastry certainty pairs well with a cup of freshly brewed latte. Overall, very positive first experience here so I'll definitely be back.

Reasons for rating:
- clean, spacious modern facility
- good coffee selection
- good pastry selection
- friendly barista team
- seating is available upstairs and downstairs

If you are waiting for oil changes on your car to finish at Oil Can Henry's, then come on over to Sightglass Coffee for a latte and a pastry.
author: Bennett W.

description: One of the coolest coffee shops I've been to. They've got great coffee, ambiance and service. I'm definitely coming back when I'm in town
author: Rentaro M.

description: This is a great spot for coffee and pastries although it is a little taken over by business meetings and people working on their laptops.
author: Daniel Q.

description:
Me: "Wow! They have Nitro Cold Brew here! Sightglass makes it the best. I'll have one to go please."

Sightglass: "Ok that'll be $4.50"

Me: "That's a little high, but I don't mind because I know NCB is more expensive to make and maintain. :pays $4.50:"

Sightglass: "Here is your child-sized 2 ounce cup of Nitro Cold Brew to-go!"

Me: " what the hell?"

Cool spot though and the crew is nice and friendly. No complaints about the staff or location. It's a great addition to Divis. 

But this was a terrible business decision to serve their Nitro Cold Brew is such a tiny cup.

You can get a regular adult human sized serving of Sightglass NCB from Le Marias Bakery on Chestnut for the same price if you want to make the trip. 

Sightglass - Please make the servings the same size as your vanilla cold brew and keep it $5 or under and I and others will be there every day buying it. You could make a killing if you ride the wave. You make it the best out of anyone and when you hoard the goods, people get turned off.
author: Jacob W.

description: My favorite coffee and pastries. I visit this place very often!!! Thanks:)I'll visit you again soon
author: Evelyn S.

description: This coffee warehouse is the perfect place to stop in for a latte and a croissant. The iced latte was delicious, but don't expect any Splenda to be available. The chocolate croissant they had was AMAZING!!! Very nice ambiance.
author: Emily B.

description:
Famous place where it's photogenic and the cold brew is good. I feel it's a little expensive for what you get though. When it gets hot, the place burns up and if it gets crowded, good luck finding a spot. Also, no wifi (they mention in their twitter coz it's a movement or some sort, but I feel like it should be a standard)

Their kouign amann is good and I like to pair them with the coffee. The sugar in the condiments section is hard to melt so I feel like they should have syrup somewhere. There is also affogato if you like those. 

I suggest if you plan to work, go upstairs, if you plan to sit and chat or photos, downstairs is nice (although people like to take a picture from the bar facing downstairs a lot. 

Fun story: Jack Dorsey of Twitter and Square invests in this place and they ship their coffee to those offices. The founders of Sightglass worked at Blue Bottle and later founded this place. That's why Square used this place as a beta test at the time and use these coffees as their promo marketing.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I had such an amazing experience here! The place was so beautiful and gives a very hip, suave feel.It is two stories and if you want to order the Affagato, you have to go upstairs to order.

I fell madly in love with the Vanilla Cold Brew Iced Coffee with Almond Milk. Usually almond milk would curdle in cold brew coffee because it won't mix well, but this place surprisingly did well for the coffee wasn't curdled from the Almond Milk. It was also interesting how they only have options of Whole Milk and Almond Milk. As a lover of Almond Milk, I was happy they had this option. The Vanilla Cold Brew Iced Coffee had the perfect amount of sweetness so I honestly didn't even add anything else.

The Bluegoon coffee was very smooth with a bit of citrus from what I recall. I love how they brew their coffees because it seems that everything is brewed smoothly.

Also, I ordered the Everything Croissant with Cream Cheese and I was honestly in love with it! I LOVE everything bagels and to have this in Croissant form really made me curious to try it! The out side is crunchy, covered in everything seasoning (garlic, onion, poppy seeds, sesame seeds, etc.), and inside had a cream cheese filling. I'm really hoping they have this pastry somewhere in LA because I'm for sure going to miss it!

This place is honestly great for small hang outs and dates, but I'm not really sure about studying since I've been looking at other people's reviews and they said this place doesn't offer Wifi. However, I still seen tons of people studying and doing work here so either they had their own Wifis or they added Wifi recently!
author: Iris C.

description:
Good coffee served to you in an open air warehouse-esque cafe where they roast the beans on site! 

lots of pastry options if you're looking to re-fuel PLUS single origin pour overs if you want to keep it pure
---Vanilla cold brew: my favorite of what we tried!
---Hookers mocha: ok, i wish it was sweeter BUT i guess they did disclaim that it wouldn't be sweet before I ordered

want to bike here? there's a rack outside to lock up!

NOTE: the upstairs seating was REALLY hot on this summer day due to the sun roof and i guess heat rises
author: Jenny S.

description:
Sightglass does not have my beloved vanilla syrup i like in my lattes so I opted for an iced vanilla almond milk cold brew and it was AMAZING.  Definitely refreshing and had a different flavor to it.  I really loved it!

The ambiance here is great.  Seating is open and bathrooms are clean.
author: Amy T.

description:
If I could still come here daily, I would. This place has my heart and is still my favorite coffee shop after two years. Sightglass is almost always very busy now, except perhaps if you come after 3 or very early in the morning.

Recommend: Vanilla Ice Cold Brew (strong) and Cascara Shrub (I like this better than Blue Bottle's -- less sugar). Any pastry is good as gold, since they are stocking from b. Patisserie and Neighbor Bakehouse (both really worth a special visit!). If you're craving something sweet, get the kouign amann or pistachio blackberry croissant. For savories, pick up the ham gruyere morning bun or everything croissant.

This location has such a grand earthy vibe and anyone who walks in for the first time can understand why the rows of seats, tables, and stools are occupied by quiet readers, students, tech employees.

Due to its location, it has a constant stream of caffeine deprived individuals throughout the morning. Sightglass does not provide wifi or outlets, but that doesn't stop people (like me) from sitting in here for hours on their macbook or doing stuff on paper. It's particularly popular for meetings and coffee chats.
author: Kathy Z.

description:
Hipster Sydney standard espresso and cold drip - praise can go no further from this coffee snob.
Beautiful warehouse surrounds. Highly recommend!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Full disclosure: I haven't tasted their coffee...yet. I was in the area and grabbed a bag. This review is for the staff and the atmosphere. Top scores for both. I'll try to remember to update this once I've checked out the brew.
author: Matthew S.

description:
My friend and I were walking down the street to where Sightglass Coffee is located and we figured that we would just pop in for a midday snack.

The folks in there were friendly, but when we got to the cashier with our one muffin each, I could hear one of the other people behind the counter making a snide remark. It was as if buying just a few muffins was a waste of their time.

I have been there before and the experiences were always good. However, if they continue to hire people who are not customer friendly, I am sure that other people are going to have the same problems I do.
author: Omar T.

description:
On the space alone, this place would be my go-to place to relax with a coffee, my laptop/book, or to have a casual hangout with a friend. The first level had plenty of seating with the beans being prepared in a different section, and there was a second "terrace" level overlooking the first floor. It honestly looked like an awesome barn that I'd live in. 

The coffee and espresso itself was damned good. I also tried out their vanilla cold brew which was really tasty as well. Definitely wish there was a spot like this near where I live in NY.
author: Matthew L.

description: Very cool layout and decor, super hipster vibes. I appreciate that the coffee is so carefully and respectfully prepared. Sadly for my taste preference, they default to that super light roast coffee which I continue to find sour tasting and lacking body/flavor.
author: Rumi R.

description:
This place is hands down one of my favorite coffee spots. When you enter, it's a large, open and airy space with the coffee counter as the focal point in the center of the room. There's plenty of seating around and even an upstairs lever to cozy up and get some work done or catch up with a friend. Coffee bag decorate the corners of the room and the amazing aroma of coffee fills the air incessantly--it's a coffee shop lover's dream. 

I usually get a mocha or latte--they're simply delightful every time. When last time I came in though, I saw that they had a menu for affogato... DEFINITELY coming back for some coffee and ice cream. The staff is friendly and gets you your order within minutes. Highly recommend for all coffee lovers!
author: Emily G.

description:
I visited Sightglass Coffee's flagship two-story space in SOMA, a hybrid coffee production roastery and coffee bar. I entered through the large wooden doors into an immense space with high ceilings. Minimalist design with concrete walls, skylights, and exposed wooden structural framework.

On the first floor, a massive coffee production machine sits in the open space; apparently it comes alive daily. Large burlap bags of coffee (with Latin American labels) are stacked on top of each other in the corner room, behind the machinery. Ahead by the counter, there's dozens of large glass jars filled with various coffee beans. An inspiring scene for coffee lovers. Upstairs, there's more space and tables. 

This was a great visit. Plenty of space to sit down, sip some high quality iced coffee served in a mason jar, and take in the rustic/hipster scene. Although as mentioned by many others, no Wifi or outlets so come prepared.
author: Behnam S.

description: A very trendy and hip coffee shop! You can smell the coffee from more than a mile away, because they roast their coffee right in the middle of the shop, where you can sit and watch them. I am sure being able to watch and smell enhance the taste of the coffee :) I tried their pastries and they are great as well! They have one gluten free option, I wish they had more but of the one I tried,definitely loved it. It's a nice place to chill and hangout with a friend, would surely go back!
author: Bzz B.

description: They really are intimate when making your coffee. It seems like they render the beans in-house too which is cool! I got the iced mocha and it was one of the better ones I've had in the city!
author: Gilles S.

description:
I used to live and also work around the area.  It's so nice to have this  cafe here.
very hipster just a heads up.
place is huge, small barista area in the middle, second floor has a barista area too plus a lot of seats.  the front part of the cafe has seats as well.
coffee is really good.
they a small variety of pastries and they were all good.
one thing I complain...maybe wifi service.  it would be nice.
author: Learnee L.

description: One of my favorite coffee shops in the city. It's not very conveniently located for me but the atmosphere here rivals that found in Four Barrel who due to its location is probably the most heavily trafficked hipster coffee stop in the city. Sightglass definitely has a lot more of a startup meeting spot vibe. This place got me hooked on Aesop skincare products as they offer these high end products in their bathroom area. Love the shared gender sinks nice progressive touch on their part, very european!
author: Justin S.

description: I love Sightglass the pour over was exceptional coffee! And I also ordered a latte and the coffee art was impressive plus the latte was delicious!! Highly recommend this place! This spot is a must see place!!
author: Cassandra H.

description:
This was our first stop driving into SF. A busy morning for the staffs, but no long lines; just people waiting around for their drink. I was about 70% awake. Can't function without having coffee first. I didn't know what I wanted so, I went with something safe, their vanilla cold brew. Though, I said "vanilla latte cold," the gentlemen was very nice to inform me it wasn't a vanilla flavored cold brew, they don't have syrups there. The beans are of a vanilla scent. Never making it seem like I didn't know what I'm ordering or being a "coffee snob" about it. Though my boyfriend RE-corrected me, because he probably felt embarassed by it.

Anyways, This spot has an upstair area as well with a coffee bar to order espressos should you need a second cup. There's no available wifi here, but everyone was on their laptop anyways. I grabbed my book and enjoyed a few chapters with my vanilla cold brew with almond milk. It was a pleasant start to the morning.
author: Helena H.

description:
Truly as good as it gets for specialty coffee. They curate the taste of their coffee and roasted varietals very well and with some of the best quality control in the industry. Rivals Blue Bottle.

I got a pour over of their $5.50/cup Columbian and it was phenomenal and it damn right better be. Grabbed a bag of their Kenyan Windrush, Kiambu Peaberry to drink at home and it beats any other roastery in the city...per usual.
author: Michael P.

description: I like the design of this place. This is a place to visit regularly because of their wonderful coffee and other drinks. I got coffee with almond milk on a hot day and it was wonderful. The service is friendly and very fast.
author: Ruben M.

description:
As everyone else mentioned, no wifi or outlets, but such a wonderful place to sit and work or read. This was the most beautiful latte I've ever received. The taste matched. Great espresso drinks.
Super friendly staff. They made me feel welcome and at home. Thing to note : upper seating requires you order from a different menu, the only general seating is on the lower level.
Highly recommend this place! Great culture, vibe, and coffee. Strangers were striking up conversations with each other. Especially since there's no wifi, it's a great place to meet people or have coffee meetings. Highly recommend!
Order a latte just for the art. Seriously.
author: Lisa O.

description:
The service is professional here and they do take their coffee seriously, but every time I've been here, I've been less impressed by the coffee than by the gorgeous, rustic, loft-like layout of the whole establishment. The two-tiered setup makes for great people watching and also gives you just enough privacy to have a business conversation or get some work done as you sit along the balcony inside. 

I'd be willing to give this place 5 stars if it had knockout coffee and wi-fi, but it's nevertheless worth a quick stop, either on your own, to meet folks for conversation, or to show friends visiting from elsewhere.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Great environment, great coffee.

My only complaint is that they don't stock half & half so can't do breve.
author: Ben W.

description:
Okay, Sight Glass coffee isn't cheap coffee. But that's exactly why you came here. Good, smooth,  flavorful expression to satisfy your senses I have to say today's visit did exactly that with a cappuccino. My cup was one of those experiences not requiring anything but just what was served. Coming from a raw sugar lover that says much. It all starts with an excellent roast. Certainly smelled great this morning. The rest is the skill of the barristo, who this visit was Matt. You made great cup today and I will be walking back down in a moment for more.  Thanks Matt!

Also taken was a pistachio croissant with blackberry paste filling. Much better than expected. A sort of risk on my part since I am a self-avowed croissant snob. While not a perfect filled affair, it was tasty and well worth the price paid .

Total for the cappuccino and pastry was $10.33.  Not cheap. Every bit fulfilled the value you might expect. 

Sight glass sells as well.  You'll probably take a pound or two when you leave. :)

As for the location it can be described as warm open warehouse look and feel with plenty of counter and table space for meeting family and friends.  Lots of windows and roof skylights let in the sun to give it a bright look augmenting the soft hanging lights. Iron work and wood every where you see. Tri-levels with a wide open view from front to back. The perfect ambiance for coffee roasting coffeehouse experience.

If you love a great coffee experience Sight Glass is one of the Must-Go places in San Francisco.
author: Chris R.

description:
Damn, I need to come here more often!

If you've ever been to the Starbucks Reserve Roastery in Seattle, this places comes a close 2nd! Wood everywhere, burlap bags of coffee beans against the wall, bikes hung up by the entrance, a mezzanine overlooking the shop, giant windows, and an island style counter. It's a great place for people to come here and read, relax, or work. I really wish I could give this place a 5, but I'm afraid I'll have to give this place 4 stars. My reasons being the price of their coffee, and very few menus. Maybe I'm blind, but I swear I only saw a few clipboards at the counter. And why am I paying $4 for 4 ounces of coffee?

I got the Vanilla Cold Brew w/ Whole Milk.

This coffee was really well brewed. It wasn't bitter at all, and I don't think they added any sweet syrup, if there was any pumped in it. The coffee had great taste and was really refreshing!  I opted for whole milk rather than almond milk because I never really enjoyed the taste of almond milk, but maybe it could go well with this coffee? Next time I'll be sure to try it. I just found out about their affogato, so I will need to buy that too!

[edit] Okay tried the cold brew w/ almond milk a couple times. Refreshing and I barely taste the almond milk. I approve.

One of the better choices of coffee to start your morning right.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Fantastic place to work/have meetings!..I like the atmosphere, lighting is great!
coffe is obviously fantastic.
Good thing about this place is you could find free parking spots nearby (which in SF is a rare thing!)
Recommended!
author: Simon L.

description:
Came here because I loved the coffee ice cream at Salt & Straw last night (uses Sightglass coffee). Ordered a Vanilla Iced Coffee with whole milk...absolutely delicious.  

With the number of premium/ specialty coffee houses serving pricey-er coffee, this is well worth it! Also - great location with a chill vibe.
author: Natalie P.

description: Great coffeehouse to spend the afternoon in. Large two-story space (with the top floor being a loft!). Has a spacious feel, but seating can still be limited on a weekend afternoon. I suggest ordering after you've secured seats. Coffee is tasty but pricey. No tea selection, but plentiful pastries!
author: Ela L.

description:
Sightglass Coffee is a great place to visit if you're in San Francisco! The ambiance is really nice with lots of natural light filling the space. 

I would highly recommend their affogatto (which you order upstairs at the affogatto bar); it's really great for summer, and the affogatto is customizable!

The only downside is that seating can be hard to find (but let's be real, that's true to any cafe in SF) and there's no wifi. So if you're planning on studying or working here, make sure you have a hotspot and a full charge!

Sightglass is a perfect place to pop in to meet up with friends and catch up. I will definitely be back!
author: Michelle P.

description:
One of the few coffee places located in the SoMa that serves cold brew. I stopped by on National Coffee Day, hoping to get my caffeine fix before clinicals. I ordered the vanilla iced cold brew, since it was highly recommended...NOT IMPRESSED. Coffee lacked flavor/character and tasted watered down. Pretty sure I felt more tired after I finished my drink. 

As many reviewers have mentioned, the people working here are miserable and hardly crack a smile. The cashier had attitude when I ordered the cold brew, and corrected me because I didn't say the whole name. I'm sure you knew what I meant, as there's only ONE iced coffee on your menu. 

Also, what kind of "high end"
coffee shop doesn't serve soy milk?! They only offered whole or almond milk, two very drastically different bases to coffee. 

Overall, I can't recommend this place to anyone. I'd rather walk further to Blue Bottle or Phil'z.
author: Ivana Y.

description: Ridiculously pretentious, over priced, no wi-fi, no outlets to plug in to, no A/C or fans, unremarkable coffee and service.
author: Angeleah W.

description: Another hipster coffee joint in town! Although I do not know how long this establishment has been open, I am glad to have yet another coffee joint in SOMA. I came in one day to purchase emergency ground coffee for my office and found Sightglass on yelp. Their ground coffee is pretty unique but I am not so sure it is worth the price. The taste is great but the price per half pound may be a bit out of my budget. Will return one day to try their in-house coffee!
author: Lushi Z.

description:
This is a gigantic location, and I believe it's also where Sightglass roasts their beans last I checked. I'm not the biggest fan of their coffee (too fruity and acidic for my tastes), but it's nice to come in here in the afternoon just to hang out a bit. 

Every time I come here there is some kind of deja vu, since the layout is quite similar to multiple other places, with a round counter where you pay and people huddling around it waiting for the drinks. The decor is contemporary (wooden with industrial undertones), and the clientele hipster. It does seem like they have more space than what is apparent but I haven't explored yet.
author: Alice C.

description:
Their Owl's Howl Espresso... WOW.

I love their lattes, they're so rich and creamy. Extra bonus for having ALMOND MILK. Ultimate perfection in a cup.
author: Debra T.

description: The atmosphere is lovely. It's the latte that's not so good. Way overpriced and weak. I really wanted to like this place!
author: P. K.

description:
I've never had the chance to try Sightglass, but I must say, that Gluten-Free Almond Cake they offered from B. Patisserie was to DIE for.

I was in the Mission for a hip little interview I had and, I have to say, as "hip" as the thing I was interviewing for was, this area has everything you would want and need for a "hip" little area. (You know that young 20-something's posse it up here, saying? Yeah. This area is just for that.)

I decided to try something that I could only get from Sightglass, and opted for their Vanilla Iced Cold Brew. It's their Owl's Howl espresso blend that is blended in cold water overnight, sweetened with organic agave nectar and Madagascar vanilla. For $4, it was definitely a pleasant difference from your average cold brew. I loved seeing the cold brew mixture mixing in through waves of white, milky vanilla and nectar. It was definitely a milkier kind of cold brew that isn't too overly-sweet... A sweet pick-me-up that didn't make me swoon but was still nice to try. (Not sure what the Owl's Howl blend actually tasted like, but it was smooth and light, not too bold of a roast.)

The gluten-free almond cake was just the perfect complement to the coffee. The guy said a lot of their pastries were already gone when I went because I came in the late afternoon, but, it was delicious...

The spot is small and is good for a quick grab-and-go. I love the clean open brown wooden coffee bar area. The seating for customers is more lounge-y, with couches ringing around the edges and small wooden tables on a nice white-and-black marble floor. It's cute and cozy and perfect for a few to work or chat, but it's not a big space to get too comfortable or have your own space. Their space invites open conversation and quick seating.

Definitely a hip crowd. They've got some great coffee and pastries, but pricing not an everyday pick-up. I seemed to have fallen in love with that pastry from B. Patisserie more than I did their coffee, but otherwise, it's a solid spot that I could see myself giving another go if I'm ever in the area again.
author: Rachel Ann C.

description: Gotten some cappuccinos with too much foam, and some with the milk a bit too hot for my tastes, but good for the most part.
author: Ian H.

description: Being from the East Coast I oft daydream of my life altering coffee experience I had from the moment I was within aroma distance. This place is the next level of next level! Master baristas operate like mad scientists amidst a balcony of Mac users typing their caffeinated fingers to the bone. Coffee is churning and turning in gigantic roasters. Massive bags of uncooked beans surround this coffee Wonka factory! The spros they do flow! The flavors supreme and smooth. Ahhh how I miss you! If you're in this cosmopolitan paradise Sightglass is a must!
author: David S.

description: Good strong coffee but very expensive. The counter is staffed with bored millennials who don't much care and sometimes don't call out names when orders are ready.
author: Jojo S.

description:
Vanilla Cold Brew - enough said. 

Definitely a cool place to chill and study at. You may not find a table (it gets pretty crowded and not a lot of tables) but if you did it has a good atmosphere. 

Would definitely come stop by again.
author: Jecedthel D.

description:
After ring shopping, we decided to grab some coffee. Super close to the jewerly center if you're hankering for some coffee after looking at sparkly diamonds. 

I ordered a vanilla cold brew with almond milk. It was super tasty! I really love vanilla ice coffee so I was sold once I saw it on the menu. The almond milk really complimented it. 

BF ordered a latte but I couldn't try it because I was sick but he really liked it. 

I asked him if he liked Sightglass or Blue Bottle more and he said Sightglass because he thinks Blue Bottle coffee has an odd sour taste. 

The shop is super cute and looks like a hipster cabin inside. Next time, I def want to have my coffee there instead of taking it to go.
author: Kelly L.

description: Their affogato (espresso with Salt & Straw ice cream) is delicious! As well as their vanilla cold brew. It's also just a really nice hangout spot - you can watch them actually roast the beans as well as package them. Would definitely come back here.
author: Anna W.

description: Coffee is just like all the other craft coffee in SF... and they don't have WiFi? The staff were also incredibly condescending when I asked about WiFi and if they new a place new buy with WiFi.
author: Slater M.

description: their coffee was good (pour over) and they hit all the pre requisites for a local indie roaster. the result a very smooth cup (black) that all indie places do well. sightglass i can imagine were like blue bottle and verve before they became indie starbucks.
author: NYSD G.

description:
4.25 for a "quick cup" of very likely delicious coffee in a medium to small size cup.
I just cannot bring myself.
Paying more for less. 
I understand  if you want to offer that to some folks who've got money to burn, but for those of us with medium incomes it's just really a blow.
I realize that sometimes the "quick cups"go for a little less... but It's usually pretty high.
author: zoe k.

description:
No wifi, no power, rude staff

The espresso I got was also very bad 

Ambience is ok but the tables are too high for working on.
author: Victor B.

description:
Sightglass is one of the few places in the Bay Area that has an affogato bar. We got a Guatemalan espresso shot with caramel ribbon ice cream. It was my first affogato and it was so good! The espresso shot tastes really strong strong, but the sweetness and smoothness of the ice cream balanced it out perfectly. 

-Kristen

It was ice cream with coffee! What more can you want! Ice cream and both coffee was good :)

-Edmund 

5 stars from Kristen, 5 stars from Kristen.
author: Kristen L.

description: Great coffee, great service, and beautiful architecture. Need I say more? I've been a regular here for years and will continue.
author: Krystal R.

description: Awesome open-industrial vibe, great coffee (I had the Colombian cup), no WiFi, but still a perfect workspace upstairs. Definitely try the raspberry-caramel-hazelnut croissant if you want a sweet breakfast.
author: Jesse D.

description:
This is a huge coffeeshop and with a nice open layout. There's a few benches and common areas downstairs and more workstations and group tables upstairs. Lots of natural light, though it can get stuffy and hot during warm days. It's a good place to hang out and do work or meet up with a friend or group of friends. Ambiance is 5 stars.

As for the coffee, Blue Bottle will mostly likely reign supreme in the espresso based drinks world for me. The lattes and cappuccinos are a little too strong for my taste but well done. My favorite is the cold brew with almond milk which is absolutely refreshing on a warm day. They have pastries brought in from local bakeries (including b.'s kouign amanns!). Service has been friendly and not snobby at all for a hipstery coffee shop.
author: Truc N.

description:
Vanilla Cold Brew with Almond milk is amazing here! Their cold brew is probably one of the best I ever had.

Tip: To order an affogato you must go to upstairs! I ordered a sea salt caramel affogato and it was soooo good. A little small but still amazing. 

PRO TIP: I personally think that the cold brew from upstairs tastes better than downstairs because they add in the milk after you order. 
Downstairs: the almond milk & coffee are already mixed into a pitcher that they pour over ice.
author: Micaela I.

description: Great cold brew and a cool atmosphere. Definitely a great local place to try if you're a coffee lover.
author: Kate A.

description: Seriously one of my favorite coffee shops in SF! I love the hipster vibes inside and obviously the taste and quality of the coffee.
author: Anastacia W.

description:
I'm on a five-star streak and Sightglass deserves ALL the stars. The expansive and peaceful two-level space makes it a great place to catch up with friends or people watch. There are plenty of seating options. I just wish people would clean up after themselves.

I ordered the vanilla cold brew with almond milk. It was so satisfying on an uncharacteristically hot day in SF. Sweet but not too sweet. The chocolate and raspberry scone was big and wonderful but it gets super messy.

Glad they don't offer WiFi, otherwise people would be camped out here for hours and it would be impossible to find seating. 

I will be back for cold brew and pastries.
author: Valerie L.

description: Great PORTLAND approved coffee house. Delicious coffee and pastry's, lighter roast so you can really appreciate the beauty of the bean. I felt at home, and my usual spots are heart and coava for context.  I got a pour over and a pistachio blackberry croissant.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
Best Cold Brew in San Francisco (Not sorry, Blue Bottle fans). Get it with almond milk to really satisfy your coffee with cream craving or have it black. Either way it's amazingly smooth, not one hint of bitterness. 

Also this place is huge compared to other coffee spots in SF. Two stories with a high ceiling and plenty of space so you're not bumping into someone when you're trying to get up from your seat. The second story has shared seating for two huge tables but there are also a few smaller ones as well. Most of the seating is bar top. NO WIFI OR ELECTRICAL OUTLETS THOUGH. Spend your time here reading a book or talking to a friend instead.
author: Nina B.

description:
First time coming here earlier this morning and was in love with the set up of this place! Very hipster place with lots of natural lighting and it's two tiered! Plenty of seating both upstairs and downstairs, but can fill up pretty quickly because this place can get very busy. There is a coffee bar on both floors. 

Ordered the affogato that is made upstairs and told the barista that it was my first time. I chose the sea salt caramel ribbon and he recommended that I pair that with the Ethiopian coffee. Took his advice and glad that I did! The coffee was very aromatic and rich in flavor. Ice cream was from salt & straw! Very very sweet. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Cynthia T.

description:
5 stars for quality coffee, service and atmosphere. 

The space is HUGE. I love the theme and design. The layout is great with plenty of seating. I love how the coffee bar area is right at the core of the space with a loft area (with an ice cream bar upstairs) that looks down onto the main level.

I told the cashier I was a newbie here and he recommended the Kenya blend. I was able to see how they were brewing my coffee and it was done in a few minutes. Love the toffee colored mug! The coffee was delicious and exactly what I was looking for on this gloomy afternoon in the city.

Experience and taste alone at this first visit are enough for me to want to come back! An affogato will be next on my to-try list.
author: Carmelisa M.

description:
This place is the coffee equivalence of a brewery - neat two-story establishment where you can see all the Inner workings of how their coffee is made and stored. Came on a Tuesday afternoon and was surprised how crowded it was. To break it down: 
Ambience: 1 million hipster points. Awesome open layout. 
Noise: very loud so if you're looking to get serious studying done, this is not the place to be. Stick to starbucks or peets coffee type places.
Coffee: Vanilla cold brew made with almond milk. Tasty but the size was so small it barely felt like 8 ounces of beverage with the ice. For the cost of $4 without tax it's expensive.

Verdict: worth a visit but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here if I am not in the neighborhood.
author: Wendy L.

description: If Coffee Superiority Complex was such a thing this place would have it.  Their coffee is on par or below Philz and the other coffee spots in The City However everyone acts as if they are the greatest gift to coffee that was ever made.  Horrible service and most of the employees give you major attitude and could care less you are giving them your money Go support another local SF coffee shop I guarantee they will appreciate your business much more
author: Colin B.

description: Love this place. It is the definition of hipster cool :-) Great coffee in a very industrial feeling space. Is one of a kind and a shame we don't have more like it in SF.
author: Selena M.

description: This coffee shop is very cool! They roast, package and sell their fresh coffee beans downstairs. Plenty of seating, downstairs & upstairs. $14 for a small latte, small drip coffee and a butter croissant. A little pricey for a daily visitor, but as tourists, it was well spent :)
author: Angie A.

description: Cold brew with milk hit the spot for me, I mean this is top notch coffee. Everytime I visit SF I WILL be making a mandatory stop here.
author: James C.

description:
GREAT coffee. Barista had major attitude problem. Thought this was the city of love?

Barista poured my drink in a mug when i had asked for it to go at the register. No big deal. I wouldnt even mind her just pouring it into a paper cup directly. Before i can say anything She tosses the drink (not the cup) so hard into the sink it splashes back onto her. 

Doesnt say anything, and she makes two or three more drinks before i get another. Finally comes out and she says nothing. No apology, no nothing.
author: Matt M.

description:
I used to live in this part of SoMa, so at one point their coffee and espresso really completed my life. Sightglass is easily one of my favorite roasters in the entire city (and I love it exponentially more than Blue Bottle, so suck it). It's slightly pricey (~$1 more than average), but very satisfying. I usually get an iced latte for $4.50 because it makes me feel like I got a bigger sized/ better value drink

This location is also beautiful, spacious, and bright. It's a great place to get some work done... if you don't need wi-fi. Dun dun dun. And there are no power outlets! Dun dun dun. For this reason, I usually don't stay long but I really wish they'd get wi-fi because there's a lot of potential for anyone to get really productive here.
author: Stephanie Joyce D.

description:
No wifi
Can't make a proper americano
Decent pastries
Expensive

Too many great coffee shops to visit in the city that had improved on the deficiencies of this one. Seriously- giant tables and a great social space but no internet? In SF? Come on...
author: Jeff B.

description:
My first time here on a Sunday morning and the line is out the door, but moves quickly. I tried the latte with almond milk. Wow. Do they know how to make a great latte. No bitter aftertaste and just enough milk without drowning out the flavor. 

Sit or stand, plenty of space but the bigger tables are usually taken by students who are camped out for the long run. I much prefer a seat downstairs where you can watch them roasting beans or people watch out the huge floor-to-ceiling front window. 

Tried the pistachio croissant with blackberry jam. Slightly sweet, fresh flaky and delicious. Perfect with a latte.
author: Sarah V.

description:
Just went here and got treated so condescendingly by their staff. I'm a teacher just down the street from this overpriced coffee shop, and even though I have my own coffeemaker in my classroom I went out for a "treat myself" mocha. Wow! Sightglass is the epitome of what is going wrong in the SoMa, aka if you're not a techie or hipster you're treated like a second-class citizen. 

Also, I must say that I used to like this place and have enjoyed their drinks and ambiance before despite the hipster-esque vibes. But I will not tolerate rudeness!
author: Valerie F.

description:
This place is truly 'out-of-sight'!

There really isn't much to say that hasn't already been said. So, I will give a brief review as to why I think this place is great! 

First of all, when you walk through their doors you are immediately hit in the face with the smell of coffee.Not just any coffee, but fresh roasted coffee straight from their roaster! A smell that is hard to come by especially since a coffee roaster is a large machine that needs space, something that is very limited within the city. 

Secondly, their coffee is bomb! Enough said. 

Last but not least, there is NO WIFI!!! Yay! The best place to get stuff done with access to amazing coffee. (On a serious note, the no wifi feature can be a killer for those that cannot live without wifi but is a great place to be productive without the distraction of the internet)

Overall, this is a great hidden gem within SF because not only do they make delicious coffee but you literally can see the whole process from roasting to pouring. If you haven't tried this place then you best get your bike/car/muni pass and go on an adventure!
author: Benson M.

description: Really Sightglass- no half and half or actual cream for your customers? I like the ambiance and coffee at Sightglass, but the complete lack of creamer options annoys the living hell out of me, especially after paying $4.50 for a coffee.
author: Julie S.

description:
WHY IS THERE NO WIFI?????

This is the coolest coffee shop! Very big and the pastry was yummy. But why is there no wifi?

The vanilla cold brew is literally amazing.
author: Tina L.

description:
Oh. Dear. God. I've died and gone to coffee heaven. I'm a believer. Hands down my favorite. It's pricey (same as Blue Bottle Prices or maybe a little more?) but so delicious.

I love the actual store too. Lots of open space and has a calming, raw vibes to it. Things are wooden, clean, and aesthetically pleasing. You'll see crates and barrels of things. They're also roasting beans in front of you.

It's on the same level as Blue Bottle. It's the kind of coffee where I could drink black and thoroughly enjoy it.
author: Mimi T.

description: This place is huge. Really cool San Francisco style decor. Roasting in house, and good selection of delicious tasting coffee
author: Chris M.

description: Would I go back to sightglass? Sure, but I'd have to order 2 coffees. One for me and one for the guy pointing the gun to my head. The coffee was undrinkable swill. I ordered the iced vanilla cold brew with almond milk. I couldn't drink it. I have 5 friends who couldn't drink it and one of them drinks mud. I saw that this place had really great yelp reviews and I love visiting trendy coffee shops so I walked a mile with my mom (who couldn't drink her coffee either) just to try the coffee. Not only do they not offer flavors for their hot coffees, they don't even have cream! Could just be that we're from Southern California, but we like our coffee to at least be drinkable. One last thing. Sightglass, if you're reading this, I don't think it's safe to serve a customer a bakery item with meat that has been sitting out for who knows how long. On a good note, at least they take the discover card.
author: Sarah T.

description: Nice open space and sitting at the top is great for people watching.  They get their pastries from local bakeries so you'll be sure to have something fresh.  The everything croissant with cream cheese was delightful.
author: Cynthia A.

description:
Loved the decor throughout the shop, coffee was good, but not the best I have tried in San Francisco ( I am from Melbourne Australia a city that's known for its boutique coffee shops, I feel the best one in San Fran so far is Chromatic Coffee in San Jose).  

Side note: the staff who served me wasn't that friendly which was a bit disappointing.
author: Celia C.

description:
I give this place 4 stars solely for the pastries and the vanilla cold brew. Their vanilla cold brew is super good with both regular milk and almond milk. Definitely different flavor nuances with the almond milk. In terms of pastries, they have good croissants. But the definite star of the show is dat chocolate chip cookie with walnuts. I call it the "crack cookie" because I'm just terribly addicted to it. 

Their hot coffee options are honestly too acidic for me, but I know that certain people do enjoy them. One star off because I basically don't go here if I want something hot.

It is a biiit pricy so keep that in mind when you swing by! The interior is super well done and hipster to the max.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
Came here twice in 2 days! 

LOVE the pastries! !!! My favorite one is the pistachio croissant! A must try! Good customer service.
author: Jun Li Z.

description:
First time in San Francisco and my first stop was Sightglass Coffee. Hands down one of my favorite shops. Cozy and hipster. In love with the vibe. Something about the rustic wood and metal combo that just feels at home. 

Since this is their company headquarters as well it's a very large space. This shop is two floors of pure joy. I could definitely spend hours and hours here just passing the time, working, with friends, etc. Workers are very friendly. Sightglass definitely offered an immersive coffee experience as they advertise. Well done.
 
Ordered a good old fashion cappuccino. It was delightful. I would happily come back anytime. Unfortunately all their locations are in SF, but that's also what makes them special.
author: Krystal A.

description:
Finally. After waiting a couple years to have Sightglass, I've finally downed every drip. First off, let me just say that this is the best looking coffee shop I've ever been to. The inside of the shop looks like an organic cabin with natural light and plants blooming. This is a 2.5 story building with he top being a small loft-like lounge for private meetings or events.

Sightglass roasts, manufactures/packages, serve and sell coffee as well as holding coffee tasting sessions. There are lots of seating for get togethers, study sessions, meetings, etc. this is a great coffee shop to just relax and sip amazing coffee.

Today I had their Guatemala drip that is more towards the medium-light side with an acidic after taste. I paired this with their pistachio croissant filled with blackberry jam. This has got to be my fav cafe pastry so far! The most amazing pastry for $4.5! 

Overall I had a great time and I'll def be stopping in more often. This is a must try and I'm so glad it's homegrown.
author: Allister D.

description: This place has amazing coffee, and a great environment to hang out in, but NO WIFI. Immediately lost 2 stars in my book as a result. What coffee shop in the 21st century lacks WiFi. That's basic. Don't come here to study/work and expect to be connected. #stoneage
author: Robby R.

description:
It's not as if I needed yet another reason to go to Sightglass (as some of you may know, they provide yours truly with a morning elixir that helps stave off sleepiness until noon) but now they're serving an afternoon delight (anyone know a good reference to Arrested Development here?) that will surely have me visiting them twice a day: affogatos.

They start off with your choice of chocolate, sea salt caramel, or blood orange gelato then pour a wonderfully creamy hot espresso over it.  Although it may sound simple, there's a level of genius that just can't be fully explained here (what I'm say is, you gotta try one for yourself).

I was initially inclined to go with the chocolate gelato since I thought it would be the best paring, but after sampling all three gelatos beforehand, and with some assurance from the barista, I decided to go with the blood orange affogato.

Holy moly, it was good . . . like a Montana/Young to Rice touchdown thing of beauty good.

ohh, got to go.
My morning caffeine high is starting to wane and since their affogato bar opens at 11 am, it's about time to make another run.

Until next time,
ciao.
author: Dan B.

description:
It is a great, "old school," coffee shop.

Their coffee and hot chocolate are amazing! If you've got a sweet tooth, don't you'll have to go add sugar yourself, no one else can get sachets for you because they don't have sugar sachets. :P

It is a great place to catch up with friends. Their interiors are nice and they don't have WiFi or charging points, so no one can work here. (If they bring a fully charged device, they can't work here for long :P )

Took off one star because their chocolate croissant had one thin strip of chocolate in it, which was a disappointment.
author: Sudhansh A.

description:
Pretty interior with hipster vibe! 
I really enjoyed the vibe but not much the coffee. 
My latte was okay but the mocha was better!
author: Yun C.

description:
My favorite coffee spot in SF. Delicious coffee and pastries. Fun environment. Ridiculously expensive mugs for purchase. ($35 for ceramic cups made all the way in.... Oakland, CA. Lol) 
But great coffee. Fun staff. Great SF vibe.
author: JonJon W.

description:
Great cappuccinos and passed with flying colors the Jo sugar needed taste test.

Pastries are great as well.

Tad pricey, but worth it for great coffee.

Also a super place to hangout and work.
author: Steven H.

description: What a surreal stupid place. Anyone who is not a hipster will not feel welcome here. Woe to people who do not realize this, including a certain so and so, haha.
author: YM L.

description: This is why I never come here. I forget how slow the service is. Shouldn't take so long to get a cappuccino. And no wifi? :|
author: Laura D.

description:
Great coffee and definitely consistent. 
Would recommend their ice coffee and Cortado
author: Eric R.

description: Hands down the best iced latte I've had in SF and the scones are divine. The staff is quick and quirky, which is what a lot of people want. There's plenty of space to meet with friends, though seats could be limited but lots walking room with high ceilings. I wish it was closer to downtown working areas or more parking, but you can normally find something.
author: Laurisha C.

description: Lots of space! A handful of pastries to choose from and a small menu of drinks- but incredible coffee. If you wish to find a no nonsense kind of coffee- here it is. Enjoy.
author: Anisa A.

description:
Coffee: YUM.  Like everyone else says - the iced vanilla cold brew does not disappoint.  I would love to try their affogato one day - I saw a few other people who ordered it and it looked amazing!

Although the drink itself was wonderful, my experience here was a bit ruined by the temperature.  On a sunday afternoon they were roasting their beans (which is really fun to watch), but the entire shop was about 10 degrees warmer than I felt comfortable in.  I'm assuming it's because they were doing the roasting, but I can't say for sure.  Not sure why nobody else seemed to have a problem with the temperature- the place was completely full!

Otherwise, I'd definitely come back here to hang out and enjoy a great cup of coffee.  Everyone seems to be relaxing and enjoying their time, and the atmosphere is pleasant.  They have restrooms in the back, upstairs seating, and plenty of open space.  The cashier and baristas were extremely friendly and clearly coffee connoisseurs who know what they're talking about.
author: Kenna H.

description:
Have you been upstairs for the affogato bar? You need to. 

Gelato from Portland's Straw + espresso = amazing.

The barristas up here will give you gelato/espresso pairing recommendations that are mindblowingly good. 

They also have a coffeefloat (iced coffee with gelato) that's a must try at least once. I usually go for the affogato tho bc the float's pretty big. You have to be dedicated and hungry to go that route.
author: Tasha D.

description: Sightglass Coffee is the kind of space where you can (a) get work done, (b) get amazing coffee, and (c) bring out-of-town guests for a memorable San Francisco experience. To this day, Sightglass ranks first on my list of SF coffee shops.
author: Bev M.

description: Vanilla iced cold brew was delicious. Not too sweet which allowed the coffee taste to still shine.
author: Adam H.

description: Too much attitude simply for a $4 cup of coffee. I love the coffee but have had enough of the unfriendly entitled "too cool for school" attitude. No thanks.
author: Brennan W.

description:
Visiting San Francisco today and decided to grab my morning coffee here on a Saturday around 10 a.m.
